translated: Then he taught the tantra of the practitioner of all his own special deities, and the tantra of the delight of all practitioners, the wisdoms.

analyzed: dum bu gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the second chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya'i ro bo nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dum bu gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya'i ro bo nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dum bu gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the third chapter will be explained, which is the essence of the perfection of wisdom, the dharma mudra of discriminating wisdom, with and without conceptualization, the antidote to the mental consciousness.

original: de nas dang po'i yid 'ong gnas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽gang dum bu gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad pa las /
analyzed: de nas dang po'i yid 'ong gnas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / gang dum bu gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad pa las /
translated: Then, beginning with the first delightful abode,🔽up to the third delightful abode,

original: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i phra mo'i gsang ba'i cho ga ma gtogs pa de dag ni gsum pa'i yang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i phra mo'i gsang ba'i cho ga ma gtogs pa de dag ni gsum pa'i yang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: except for the secret rite of the subtle vajra blazing fire, which was explained in the second chapter, it should be understood that they are also of the third chapter.

analyzed: gang dag khyad par gzhan dag yod pa de dag ni phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: Those that have other distinctions will be explained later.

original: dum bu gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: dum bu gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the third chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid mig dang / rna ba dang / rna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dum bu bzhi pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid mig dang / rna ba dang / rna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dum bu bzhi pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the wisdom of successful activities, the perfection of effort, the nature of the karma-mudra, the antidote to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, the meaning of the fourth section will be explained.

original: de nas gnas yid du 'ong bar zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas gnas yid du 'ong bar zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning with “in a pleasant place,”

analyzed: gang dum bu gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad pa las rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i phra mo'i gsang ba'i cho ga ma gtogs pa gzhan pa de dag thams cad ni 'di'i yang yin par shes par byas la /
translated: all of that which was explained in the meaning of the second section, except for the secret rite of the subtle vajra-fierce-fire, should be understood to be also of this [fourth section].

original: gang 'di la khyad par du gyur pa de dag ni phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la khyad par du gyur pa de dag ni phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: That which is special here will be explained later.

original: dum bu bzhi pa'i bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: dum bu bzhi pa'i bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the fourth section is complete.

original: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad pas /
analyzed: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i bsdus pa'i don bshad pas /
translated: By explaining the meaning of the summary as it was explained,

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i brjod par bya ba bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i brjod par bya ba bshad pa yin la /
translated: The Blessed One is the subject matter of the Supreme Original Vajra Holder.

original: de ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud de rgyud ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud de rgyud ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The collection of words that teach that is the tantra. Tantra is the subject matter.

original: de ltar na brjod par bya ba dang / brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na brjod par bya ba dang / brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel ba'o //
translated: Thus, the subject matter and the teaching have the nature of a connection.

original: gdul bya rnams dpal mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams dpal mchog dang po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la 'dod pa bskyed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to generate desire in the disciples for the Supreme Original Vajra Holder.

original: 'dod pa bskyed pa de dag kyang dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas de'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa bskyed pa de dag kyang dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas de'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of that is to make the nature of that manifest through entering the mandala and so forth.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi grangs bshad par bya ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dum bu la ni dkyil @64a * //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi grangs bshad par bya ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dum bu la ni dkyil @64a * //
translated: The number of mandalas should be explained in that context.

original: 'khor bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bco lnga pa'o //
translated: In the section on the perfection of wisdom, there are fifteen mandalas.

original: dum bu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud la ni bcu gcig go //
analyzed: dum bu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud la ni bcu gcig go //
translated: In the root tantra of the second section, there are eleven.

original: de nyid rtog pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i rgyud dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud la ni bcu'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtog pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i rgyud dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud la ni bcu'o //
translated: That is the root tantra of all the tantras of the later [vehicles], and it has ten [chapters].

original: yang 'di'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ni drug go //
analyzed: yang 'di'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ni drug go //
translated: Moreover, its maṇḍala has six families.

original: dum bu gsum pa la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: dum bu gsum pa la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
translated: In the three-part [maṇḍala], there are twenty-one [deities].

original: dum bu bzhi pa la yang dkyil 'khor nyi shu rtsa gcig yod do //
analyzed: dum bu bzhi pa la yang dkyil 'khor nyi shu rtsa gcig yod do //
translated: In the four-part [maṇḍala], there are also twenty-one maṇḍalas.

original: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i nam mkha'i khams thams cad dang mnyam par bzhugs shing rigs thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i gzugs can sems can rnams kyi don mdzad par ro gcig pa ni dpal lo //
analyzed: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i nam mkha'i khams thams cad dang mnyam par bzhugs shing rigs thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i gzugs can sems can rnams kyi don mdzad par ro gcig pa ni dpal lo //
translated: There, the Great Vajradhara, abiding equal to the realm of space, having the nature of all families, the form of the body, speech, and mind vajras, acting for the welfare of sentient beings, is of one taste. That is glorious.

original: de nyid ni mchog dang po ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mchog dang po ste /
translated: That itself is the supreme first.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Supreme means excellent.

original: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa da ltar byung ba nas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa nyid du bzhugs pas na de'i phyir dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa da ltar byung ba nas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa nyid du bzhugs pas na de'i phyir dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it abides as the essence of the beginningless and endless nature, it is called the first.

original: de ston pa'i de kho na nyid bcu'i ming gi tshogs ni rgyud ches bya ste /
analyzed: de ston pa'i de kho na nyid bcu'i ming gi tshogs ni rgyud ches bya ste /
translated: The collection of names of the ten realities that teach that is the tantra.

original: rgyud ni rgyud zhes bya bar bshad ;🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyud zhes bya bar bshad ; ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Tantra is explained as continuum.

original: de la de kho na nyid bcu'i dkyil 'khor dang / sngags dang phyag rgya dang / bsrung ba dang / spyan drang ba dang / slob dpon gyi las kyi dbye ba dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa dang / bzlas brjod dang /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid bcu'i dkyil 'khor dang / sngags dang phyag rgya dang / bsrung ba dang / spyan drang ba dang / slob dpon gyi las kyi dbye ba dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa dang / bzlas brjod dang /
translated: Therein, the mandala of the ten realities, the mantra, the seal, the protection, the invocation, the division of the master's activities, the extensive rite of inducting the disciple, and so forth, the repetition,

original: bsgom pa dang / sbyin sreg dang / nye bar bsdu ba dang / mchod nas slar gshegs su gsol ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang / sbyin sreg dang / nye bar bsdu ba dang / mchod nas slar gshegs su gsol ba'o //
translated: the meditation, the fire sacrifice, the conclusion, and the worship and request for departure.

original: dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud kyi bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud kyi bsdus pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The summarized meaning of the glorious Supreme Original Tantra is complete.

original: // / de lta bu'i dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud sdud par byed pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug lcang lo can gyi pho brang na gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang bas blo la gzhag nas 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: // / de lta bu'i dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud sdud par byed pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug lcang lo can gyi pho brang na gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang bas blo la gzhag nas 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: The compiler of the Tantra of the Supreme Original Buddha, the Lord of the Tenth Stage, Vajradhara, who resides in the palace of Alakavati, having placed it in his mind, said this and so forth.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa'i bshad ma thag pa'i gzhung dang don gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa'i bshad ma thag pa'i gzhung dang don gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, this is the nature of the text and meaning that was just explained, which is summarized as “this.”

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yin par ston pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yin par ston pa ste /
translated: “By me” indicates that it was taught by me.

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis thos kyi gzhan las brgyud de 'ongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it was heard by me, not that it came from another source.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes rab 'khrul pa med pa'i rnam par shes pas thos kyi rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes rab 'khrul pa med pa'i rnam par shes pas thos kyi rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: “Heard” indicates that it was heard by the wisdom that is the nature of hearing, by unmistaken consciousness, and not that it was realized.

original: 'dis ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa yang yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa yang yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that he heard it directly from himself and that he was in a state of meditative equipoise.

original: gang gi tshe khyod kyis thos @64b she na ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod kyis thos @64b she na ;

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba smras te /

original: dus gcig ni dus tshod gcig na thos kyi /
analyzed: dus gcig ni dus tshod gcig na thos kyi /

analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni gzhan dag thos so zhes bya ba ste /

original: 'dis ni bdag nyid thos pa mang bar ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid thos pa mang bar ston to //
translated: This shows that he is very learned.

original: yang na dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig la rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos bas /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig la rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos bas /
translated: Or, “at one time” means that he heard the inconceivable liberation in one moment.

analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la yang dus gsum gyi bskal pa rnams so sor snang ba'am /

analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid tshad ma'i skyes bu yin par ston to //

analyzed: khyod kyis gang las gang du thos zhes rtog pa de dag gi phyir /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: 'dir 'brel pa'i ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lha'i rgyal po gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na bzhugs te /

analyzed: de las bdag gis rgyud thos so zhes pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /

analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang / dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du ston to //

translated: It also shows that those who practice the conduct of the mantra

translated: gate should know the vow.🔽The Bhagavat, with that nondual mind and mental factor that is the

translated: nature of the perfection of generosity, which arose from all the tathagatas,🔽placed the jeweled crown on Vajrapani's head.

analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur ba dang ldan pas shes par bya'o zhes ston par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: It also shows that those who practice the mantra vehicle should know that they are consecrated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The very mind and mental factors of the nondual intuition of the perfection of wisdom of all tathāgatas is the intuition of omniscience.

original: rnal 'byor chen po de gang la yod pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po de gang la yod pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: He who has that great yoga is the great yoga endowed with the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de yang dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
translated: And he is called “Lord.”

original: dbang phyug dang ldan pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ldan pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug go //
translated: Since he is endowed with lordship, he is the Lord of the Great Yoga endowed with the gnosis of omniscience of all the Tathāgatas.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das padma'i rigs thugs su chud cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa mkhyen pas na rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug ces bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das padma'i rigs thugs su chud cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa mkhyen pas na rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug ces bshad pa yin la /
translated: This also explains that the Blessed One is the Lord of Yoga because he comprehends and knows the lotus family and knows the abode of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis kyang rnal 'byor la dbang phyug tu gyur par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis kyang rnal 'byor la dbang phyug tu gyur par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: And it shows that those who practice the conduct through the gateway of mantra should also become lords of yoga.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor chen po ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes nas de bzhin du gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor chen po ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes nas de bzhin du gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: The Bhagavat, having attained the perfection of his own aim by understanding the yoga of the great wisdom of omniscience just as it is, acts for the aim of others in the same way.

original: @65b de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: @65b de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Thus, he says, “of all Tathagatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: The perfection of effort is all Tathagatas.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya thams cad de sems can gyi khams rnams byang chub la brtson 'grus kyi gzugs brnyan bskyed pa'i phyir rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya thams cad de sems can gyi khams rnams byang chub la brtson 'grus kyi gzugs brnyan bskyed pa'i phyir rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir te /
translated: That itself is the seal of all seals, because it seals the realms of sentient beings by generating the reflected image of effort for enlightenment.

original: de nyid ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is sameness.

original: de thugs su chud pa ni brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: de thugs su chud pa ni brnyes pa'o //
translated: The understanding of that is attainment.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Various refers to all the realms of sentient beings.

original: bya ba mdzad de zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba mdzad de zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Having performed deeds means having completed the desired aim.

original: bya ba mdzad pa nyid kyis bya ba mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba mdzad pa nyid kyis bya ba mdzad pa ste /
translated: Having performed deeds is the performance of deeds.

original: nges sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams cad kyi re ba thams cad ces bya ba rnam pa thams cad du phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa 'thob par sred pa'o //
analyzed: nges sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams cad kyi re ba thams cad ces bya ba rnam pa thams cad du phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa 'thob par sred pa'o //
translated: Having fulfilled all the hopes of all sentient beings without exception means that all the desires for the attainment of the great seal and so on are fulfilled in every way.

original: de yongs su skong ba ni mngon par 'dod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su skong ba ni mngon par 'dod pa thob pa'o //
translated: Fulfilling them is the attainment of the desired aim.

original: de nyid ni phrin las te de mdzad pas na re ba thams cad yongs su skong ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni phrin las te de mdzad pas na re ba thams cad yongs su skong ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'o //
translated: That itself is the activity, and since he performs that, he is the one who performs the activity of fulfilling all hopes.

original: ma lus pa'i sgra bshad pa ni mtha' dag gi ming ma yin pa yang srid pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i sgra bshad pa ni mtha' dag gi ming ma yin pa yang srid pa nyid yin no //
translated: The explanation of the word “all” is that it is possible that it is not the name of the totality.

original: de bas na lus pa med pa'i sgra ni mtha' dag gi don gyi ming yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lus pa med pa'i sgra ni mtha' dag gi don gyi ming yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word “without exception” is the name of the meaning of the totality.

original: yang na ma lus pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
analyzed: yang na ma lus pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
translated: Or, “without exception” is in all world systems.

original: lus pa med pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad do zhes bya bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: lus pa med pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad do zhes bya bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “without exception” should be explained as “without remainder.”

original: gang du sems can gyi khams thams cad ces smos pa'i tshig yod pa der ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa nas sems can gyi khams thams cad ces bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du sems can gyi khams thams cad ces smos pa'i tshig yod pa der ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa nas sems can gyi khams thams cad ces bshad par bya'o //
translated: Wherever the phrase “all realms of sentient beings” occurs, it should be explained as “all realms of sentient beings without exception in all world-realms without exception.”

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis las kyi rigs kyang thugs su chud do zhes kyang ston pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis las kyi rigs kyang thugs su chud do zhes kyang ston pa yin la /
translated: This also shows that the Blessed One has understood the types of karma.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyad pa spyod pas kyang sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i rig sngags grub pas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba la sogs pa'i las rnams la 'jug par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyad pa spyod pas kyang sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i rig sngags grub pas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba la sogs pa'i las rnams la 'jug par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: It also shows that those who practice the conduct of mantra should engage in the activities of drawing mandalas and so forth in order to accomplish the knowledge mantras that take care of sentient beings.

original: de ltar gyur pa su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Who is it that does this?

original: thugs rje che ba rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thugs rje che ba rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “the great compassion of Vairocana” is stated.

original: mi dmigs shing rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i thugs rje mnga' bas na thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs shing rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i thugs rje mnga' bas na thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: Great compassion is the great compassion that is non-apprehending and arises by its very nature.🔽Vairocana is the one who is beautiful and illuminating by the method of the Tathagata and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyi tshul gyis rnam par mdzes shing snang bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad dam rnam par snang mdzad pa nyid yin pas na /🔽@66a * // rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyi tshul gyis rnam par mdzes shing snang bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad dam rnam par snang mdzad pa nyid yin pas na / @66a * // rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairocana is the one who is beautiful and illuminating by the method of the Tathagata and so forth.

original: de nyid ni chos kyi sku dang / rnam par smin pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni chos kyi sku dang / rnam par smin pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus rtag pa'o //
translated: That very one is eternal by means of the dharmakaya, the maturation body, and the saṃbhogakāya.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum ni dus gsum mo //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum ni dus gsum mo //
translated: The three times are the past, future, and present.

original: dus de dag tu mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i sprul pa'i sku bzhugs pa'o ;
analyzed: dus de dag tu mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i sprul pa'i sku bzhugs pa'o ;
translated: He abides in the equality of those times, meaning that he abides in the nirmāṇakāya.

original: / yang na dus gsum po dag gi dus su kun rdzob kyi gzugs la bzhugs kyi /
analyzed: / yang na dus gsum po dag gi dus su kun rdzob kyi gzugs la bzhugs kyi /
translated: Alternatively, he abides in the form of the relative in the three times,

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin pas dus gsum gyi mnyam pa nyid la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin pas dus gsum gyi mnyam pa nyid la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: but since he does not exist ultimately, he abides in the equality of the three times.

original: sku thams cad ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sku thams cad ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: All bodies are of four kinds:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / rnam pa smin pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / rnam pa smin pa'i sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: the essential body, the body of perfect enjoyment, the body of transformation, and the body of the universal basis.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: gang 'di rgya chen du ma yi //
analyzed: gang 'di rgya chen du ma yi //
translated: This is the secret of the body,🔽the division of the many extensive

original: kha dog dbyibs dang gdan rnams dang // phyag mtshan sna tshogs dbye bar ni //🔽sku yi gsang ba 'di zhes bya //
analyzed: kha dog dbyibs dang gdan rnams dang // phyag mtshan sna tshogs dbye bar ni // sku yi gsang ba 'di zhes bya //
translated: colors, shapes, seats, and various

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: hand implements.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thams cad dang rdo rje'i rigs ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i tshul lo //🔽rin po che'i rigs thams cad ni rnam par smin pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thams cad dang rdo rje'i rigs ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i tshul lo // rin po che'i rigs thams cad ni rnam par smin pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The entire lineage of the Tathagata and the vajra lineage are the mode of the essential body.🔽The entire lineage of the jewel is the nature of the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: padma'i rigs thams cad ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: padma'i rigs thams cad ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The entire lineage of the lotus is the nature of the body of transformation.

original: las kyi rigs thams cad ni sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi rigs thams cad ni sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The entire lineage of action is the nature of the body of the universal basis.

original: yang phyag rgya chen po gtso bor gyur pa byang chub kyi sems dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: yang phyag rgya chen po gtso bor gyur pa byang chub kyi sems dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
translated: Again, the family of the Tathagata is the family of the great seal, which is the chief of the families, and which is the nature of the thought of enlightenment and of the mirror-like intuition.

original: dam tshig phyag rgya gco bor gyur pa spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni rin po che'i rigs so //
analyzed: dam tshig phyag rgya gco bor gyur pa spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni rin po che'i rigs so //
translated: The family of the Jewel is the family of the pledge seal, which is the chief of the families, and which is the nature of the perfection of generosity and of the intuition of equality.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i rigs can chos kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i rigs can chos kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: The family of the Lotus is the family of the doctrine seal, which is the chief of the families, and which is the nature of the perfection of wisdom and of the individually discerning intuition.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas 'gro ba'i don byas pa las kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni las kyi rigs yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas 'gro ba'i don byas pa las kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can ni las kyi rigs yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The family of Action is the family of the action seal, which is the chief of the families, and which is the nature of the perfection of effort and of the intuition of successful activities.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid can yin pas mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid can yin pas mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na /
translated: The vajra family is also of the nature of the spirit of enlightenment, and so is of the nature of Akshobhya.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood to be of the nature of mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs rnams kyang sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs rnams kyang sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The external vajra families are also of the nature of the emanation body, and so are of the nature of the primordial wisdom of successful activities.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: rdo rje sems @66b dpa'i dbang bskur bas /
analyzed: rdo rje sems @66b dpa'i dbang bskur bas /
translated: By the empowerment of Vajrasattva,

original: ngo bo nyid skur shes par bya //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid skur shes par bya //
translated: one should know the essence body.

original: rdo rje rin chen dbang bskur bas //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen dbang bskur bas //
translated: By the empowerment of Vajraratna,

original: de bzhin mtshan dang dpe byang yin //
analyzed: de bzhin mtshan dang dpe byang yin //
translated: one should know the major and minor marks.

original: rdo rje chos kyi dbang bskur bas //
analyzed: rdo rje chos kyi dbang bskur bas //
translated: By the empowerment of Vajradharma,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru 'dod //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru 'dod //
translated: one should know the enjoyment body.

original: rdo rje las kyi dbang bskur bas //
analyzed: rdo rje las kyi dbang bskur bas //
translated: By the empowerment of Vajrakarma,

original: sprul pa yi ni sku ru 'dod //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa yi ni sku ru 'dod //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one should know the emanation body.

original: gsung thams cad ni rab tu dga' ba dang / rdo rje dang / khro bo dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bka'i tshig gi bye brag gis rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gsung thams cad ni rab tu dga' ba dang / rdo rje dang / khro bo dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bka'i tshig gi bye brag gis rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: All the Speech is of five kinds, according to the distinctions of the Speech of the Joyous, the Vajra, the Wrathful, the Meditative Concentration, and the Words of Command.

original: thugs thams cad ni thugs ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rang gi rigs kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya rnams te /
analyzed: thugs thams cad ni thugs ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rang gi rigs kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya rnams te /
translated: All the Minds are the seals of the signs of their own families, on the moon-discs in the hearts.

original: de dag kyang mi phyed par mnga' bas na sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad rdo rje'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi phyed par mnga' bas na sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad rdo rje'o // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: And since they possess those inseparably, they are the Vajra of all Bodies, Speech, and Minds.

original: yang na de bzhin du gzhan rnams la ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste /🔽'dis kyang gang las thos pa'i ston pa po de ni /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin du gzhan rnams la ston par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste / 'dis kyang gang las thos pa'i ston pa po de ni /
translated: The Tathagata is so called because he has awakened to the way all things really exist, or because he has taught that to others in the same way.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bsdus par gyur pa ni rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bsdus par gyur pa ni rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This also shows that the teacher from whom he heard it is the one who is the embodiment of all the Buddhas, Vairocana.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan sngon du 'gro ba'i bshad pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan sngon du 'gro ba'i bshad pa byas nas /
translated: Having thus explained the qualities of the Bhagavat in the beginning,🔽in response to the thought, “Where does the Bhagavat, who has such qualities, dwell?” he says, “The abode of all the Tathagatas,” and so on.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de gang na bzhugs zhes rnam par rtog pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas gnas smras pa yin te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs shing bstan pa yin te
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de gang na bzhugs zhes rnam par rtog pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas gnas smras pa yin te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs shing bstan pa yin te
translated: It is the abode of all the Tathagatas, and it is taught.

original: de bas na bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bsngags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is praised.

original: bsngags par gyur pa nyid kyis na bstod pa ste /
analyzed: bsngags par gyur pa nyid kyis na bstod pa ste /
translated: Since it is praised, it is extolled.

original: der nor bu dang rin po che chen po ste /
analyzed: der nor bu dang rin po che chen po ste /
translated: There are jewels and great jewels.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / rin po che zhes bya ba rdo rje la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / rin po che zhes bya ba rdo rje la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel and jewels such as diamonds.

original: de rnams kyis spras pa ni gang du mdzes par bya ba'i phyir spras shing spel ba der kha dog sna tshogs pa'i dril bu btags pa dang / dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyis spras pa ni gang du mdzes par bya ba'i phyir spras shing spel ba der kha dog sna tshogs pa'i dril bu btags pa dang / dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang /
translated: Adorned with those means that in order to beautify it, it is adorned and enhanced with various colored bells, silk, banners, flower garlands, tails,🔽nets, half-nets, and moons moved by the wind.🔽It is adorned with those that beautify it.

original: dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba rlung gi bskyod pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par gyur pas brgyan pa phyogs bcu thams cad na gnas pa'i 'dod pa'i khams thams cad na lha'i rgyal po gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba rlung gi bskyod pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par gyur pas brgyan pa phyogs bcu thams cad na gnas pa'i 'dod pa'i khams thams cad na lha'i rgyal po gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: It is the abode of the king of the gods of the desire realm, who resides in the abode of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods in all the desire realms in the ten directions.🔽The five sense objects emanated by others

original: de la gzhan rnams kyis sprul pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams te /🔽de rnams la dbang bskur @67a * //
analyzed: de la gzhan rnams kyis sprul pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams te / de rnams la dbang bskur @67a * //
translated: are the objects of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods.

original: ba'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kya lha rnams sa //
analyzed: ba'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kya lha rnams sa //
translated: The one who has the mode of bestowing power over those is the Paranirmitavasavartin god.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po'i dang po'i gnas su bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po'i dang po'i gnas su bzhugs pa ste /
translated: He resides in the first abode of those gods.

original: rdo rje lha mo'i tshogs kyi dbus su bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje lha mo'i tshogs kyi dbus su bzhugs pa /
translated: He is in the center of the assembly of the Vajra Goddesses.

original: rab tu dga' ba chen po'i sku 'dzin par mdzad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba chen po'i sku 'dzin par mdzad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i rgyal po'o //
translated: The Great Vajradhara, who assumes the form of the Great Joy, is the king of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods.

original: der gyur nas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing nam mkha' thams cad la rab tu bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i bzhugs gnas su bcom ldan 'das bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der gyur nas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing nam mkha' thams cad la rab tu bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i bzhugs gnas su bcom ldan 'das bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having become that, the Blessed One abides in the abode of the Blessed Vajrasattva, who abides in all space.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ji ltar na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i rgyal por gyur pa de ni 'di'i 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ji ltar na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i rgyal por gyur pa de ni 'di'i 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: How the Blessed Vajrasattva became the king of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods will be explained later.

original: 'dis kyang gang du thos pa de ston par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang gang du thos pa de ston par gyur pa yin no //
translated: This also shows where it was heard.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the perfection of the qualities of the abode of the Blessed One,

original: da ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the perfection of the retinue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgya dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgya dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He was together with a hundred billion bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag de dag gi nang nas sgrub pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa ni phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag de dag gi nang nas sgrub pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa ni phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: Among those hundred billion bodhisattvas, the one who became the branch of accomplishment was the bodhisattva Vajrapani and so forth.

original: rva nas bzung ba'i tshul gyis ston par 'dod nas 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rva nas bzung ba'i tshul gyis ston par 'dod nas 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Desiring to teach by the method of holding a horn, he said, “Thus…” and so forth.

original: de la 'di'i phyag na rdo rje mnga' bas na phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de la 'di'i phyag na rdo rje mnga' bas na phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: There, he is Vajrapani because he wields a vajra in his hand.

original: spyan gyis rnam par blta ba ni spyan ras gzigs te /
analyzed: spyan gyis rnam par blta ba ni spyan ras gzigs te /
translated: Avalokita is one who looks with eyes.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o zhes so sor rtog cing thams cad la skyob pa'i phyir gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o zhes so sor rtog cing thams cad la skyob pa'i phyir gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: He is Avalokita because he looks at the pure nature of all phenomena, individually discriminating them, and because he protects all.

original: dbang phyug ni de la mnga' brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni de la mnga' brnyes pa'o //
translated: Isvara is one who has attained mastery over that.

original: nam mkha' ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Space is the wisdom of equality.

original: snying po ni skye ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: snying po ni skye ba'i gnas te /
translated: The essence is the place of birth.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: He who has that is Akashagarbha.

original: chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes bya ba bsgom pa 'dis chos thams cad gcig tu byed pa'i khu tshur gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje khu tshur te /
analyzed: chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes bya ba bsgom pa 'dis chos thams cad gcig tu byed pa'i khu tshur gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje khu tshur te /
translated: The meditation that all phenomena are naturally luminous is the fist that unifies all phenomena. He who has that is Vajrapani.

original: de bzhin nyid bden mi slu gang //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bden mi slu gang //
translated: The reality of nondeceptive suchness

original: rdo rje khu tshur du bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur du bshad do // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is explained as Vajrapani.

original: 'jam zhing mnyen pa'i dpal gang la yod pa de ni 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: 'jam zhing mnyen pa'i dpal gang la yod pa de ni 'jam dpal te /
translated: He who has the glory of gentleness is Manjusri.

original: gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i rgyu las nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis na nyon @67b mongs pa'i rtsub pa dang bral zhing na tshod lo brgyad pa'i gzhon nu'i gzugs mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i rgyu las nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis na nyon @67b mongs pa'i rtsub pa dang bral zhing na tshod lo brgyad pa'i gzhon nu'i gzugs mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from the coarseness of afflictions and possesses the form of a youth of eight years of age, he definitely arises from the cause of abiding in nondual transcendent wisdom.

original: sems bskyed ma thag pa'i rjes thogs nyid la chos kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rab tu bskor zhing sprul pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o ;
analyzed: sems bskyed ma thag pa'i rjes thogs nyid la chos kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rab tu bskor zhing sprul pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o ;
translated: He who, immediately after arousing the Thought, turns the wheel of the Doctrine, has the manner of an emanation.

original: / nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: / nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Space is the all-pervading, the intuition of equality.

original: de nyid kyi mdzod 'di la mnga' bas na nam mkha'i mdzod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi mdzod 'di la mnga' bas na nam mkha'i mdzod do //
translated: He who has mastery over that treasure is the Sky Treasure.

original: phung po'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi ba dag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ni bdud thams cad do //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi ba dag gi bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ni bdud thams cad do //
translated: All the demons are the demon of the aggregates, the demon of the afflictions, the demon of death, and the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: de rnams 'joms shing mi snang bar mdzad pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni bdud kyi stobs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'joms shing mi snang bar mdzad pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni bdud kyi stobs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'o //
translated: He who has the nature of destroying and making invisible all those is the one who destroys all the powers of the demons.

original: de la byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ni gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rje bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ni gsang sngags 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rje bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach that the mantra is accomplished by arousing the Thought of Awakening, Vajrapani is taught.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes chos la bdag med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes chos la bdag med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bstan pa yin no //
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara is taught in order to show that all phenomena are naturally completely pure is accomplished by being endowed with the meditation on the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje gcig tu bya ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bshes pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas 'grub par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje khu tshur bstan pa yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje gcig tu bya ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bshes pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas 'grub par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje khu tshur bstan pa yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Vajra fist is taught in order to show that the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas are one vajra, naturally luminous is accomplished by meditating on the perfection of effort of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal bstan pa yin no //
translated: Noble Mañjuśrī is taught in order to show that the perfection of wisdom is accomplished by meditating on the perfection of wisdom.

original: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pas 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pas 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma wheel-turning immediately upon the generation of the thought is taught in order to show that accomplishment comes from entering the maṇḍala.

original: mchod pa thams cad la 'jug pas 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i mdzod bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad la 'jug pas 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i mdzod bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the Akasagarbhadhara is for the sake of showing that one is successful if one enters into all the offerings.

original: bgegs thams cad bzlog par nus na 'grub par gsungs pa'i phyir rdo rje gnod spyin bstan pa yin par bsgrub pa'i yan lag ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bgegs thams cad bzlog par nus na 'grub par gsungs pa'i phyir rdo rje gnod spyin bstan pa yin par bsgrub pa'i yan lag ston pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the Vajrayaksa is for the sake of showing that one is successful if one is able to ward off all the obstructors.

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang la de dag gtso bor gyur pa de ni de dag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang la de dag gtso bor gyur pa de ni de dag la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase and so on means that the principal ones are those who are foremost in that group.

original: de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad kyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yongs su bskor zhing kun nas 'khor bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad kyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yongs su bskor zhing kun nas 'khor bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana was surrounded and attended by eight hundred million Bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: @68a * // mdun gyis bltas nas zhes bya ba ni gus pas khyad par du phul du byung ba'i sems kyis yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @68a * // mdun gyis bltas nas zhes bya ba ni gus pas khyad par du phul du byung ba'i sems kyis yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase facing him means that they were present with a special, superior attitude of respect.

original: der ci zhig mdzad ce na chos ston te zhes bya ba smos te dam pa'i chos ston par mdzad cing rab tu 'chad par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der ci zhig mdzad ce na chos ston te zhes bya ba smos te dam pa'i chos ston par mdzad cing rab tu 'chad par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: What does he do there? He teaches the Dharma. This means that he teaches and explains the sublime Dharma.

original: mtshan ni ji skad du btags khyad par ni ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i chos ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: mtshan ni ji skad du btags khyad par ni ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i chos ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: What is the name of the Dharma that he teaches? What is its special quality?

original: thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma that is good in the beginning, etc.

original: dang po thos bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na yang dad pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas na thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: dang po thos bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na yang dad pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas na thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: It is good in the beginning because it is a cause of faith at the stage of listening.

original: bar du bsam pa'i gnas skabs na yang dge ba'i rgyur gyur pas na bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: bar du bsam pa'i gnas skabs na yang dge ba'i rgyur gyur pas na bar du dge ba'o //
translated: It is good in the middle because it is a cause of virtue at the stage of reflection.

original: tha mar sgom pa'i shes rab kyi gnas skabs na yang grol ba'i rgyur gyur pas na tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar sgom pa'i shes rab kyi gnas skabs na yang grol ba'i rgyur gyur pas na tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: It is good in the end because it is a cause of liberation at the stage of wisdom in meditation.

original: yang na lha ga pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rdzogs par byed pas na thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: yang na lha ga pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rdzogs par byed pas na thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is good in the beginning because it perfects the training in ethical discipline.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rdzogs par byed pas na bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rdzogs par byed pas na bar du dge ba'o //
translated: It is virtuous in the middle because it perfects the training in superior mind.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rdzogs par byed pas na tha mar dge ba'o zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rdzogs par byed pas na tha mar dge ba'o zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: It is virtuous in the end because it perfects the training in superior wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bor gyur pas na don bzang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bor gyur pas na don bzang po'o //
translated: It has good meaning because it is the essence of the words of the thought of enlightenment and so on.

original: tshig cam ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas na tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
analyzed: tshig cam ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas na tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
translated: It has good phrasing because it is free from the faults of being mere words and so on.

original: chos dang gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang bral bas nam 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang bral bas nam 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is unadulterated because it is free from the grasping of persons and things.

original: theg pa ma lus pa lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par byed pas na yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa ma lus pa lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par byed pas na yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is complete because it causes the attainment of the intended goal of beings who aspire to all the vehicles.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure because it has the nature of teaching all things as having the nature of non-substantiality.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the essence of the stage of utmost joy.

original: 'di nyid bsgom pa'i lam la yang dang yang du mngon du byed pa yin pas na yongs su byang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsgom pa'i lam la yang dang yang du mngon du byed pa yin pas na yongs su byang ba ste /
translated: Since this is also repeatedly manifested on the path of meditation, it is completely purified.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi chos ston par mdzad do zhes khyad par du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi chos ston par mdzad do zhes khyad par du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, he teaches the Dharma that has such a nature.

original: da ni ming nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba smos te chos thams cad ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni ming nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba smos te chos thams cad ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to teach the name, he says, the gateway of the intrinsic purity of all phenomena. All phenomena are the Joyful One and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa ni de rnams kyi don dam pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa ni de rnams kyi don dam pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Their intrinsic purity is the ultimate naturelessness of those.

original: de'i sgo ni 'jug pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo ni 'jug pa'i gnas so //
translated: The gateway to that is the basis of engagement.

original: de yang gang gis mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang gis mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is that by which it is manifested.

original: 'di @68b ltar rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di @68b ltar rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, this basis of the purity of the Joyful One is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gang gi phyir de thos pa la sogs pa'i shes rab kyis thos pa de la ni de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gang gi phyir de thos pa la sogs pa'i shes rab kyis thos pa de la ni de skad ces bya la /
translated: The abode of the bodhisattvas and so on. Because of that, the wisdom of hearing and so on hears that, and it is called that.

original: ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i gsang ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gang yin pa de ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i gsang ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gang yin pa de ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is the one who teaches that which is called by that name, the method of the secret perfection of wisdom.

original: de la rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Therein, the aspect of reality of the stages of joy and so on is wisdom.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin cing 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin cing 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Going beyond that and proceeding is the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the special path of liberation that has the nature of manifesting the mind of enlightenment and so on.

original: de'i tshul ni sngar bshad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshul ni sngar bshad pa nyid de /
translated: The method of that is just as previously explained.

original: des de thob pa gang yin pa de yang dag par ston pa ni rab tu 'chad par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: des de thob pa gang yin pa de yang dag par ston pa ni rab tu 'chad par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The one who attains that by that is the one who perfectly teaches, who explains.

original: gang 'di ston par mdzad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'di ston par mdzad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that perfection of wisdom by which he teaches?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar ston pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar ston pa'i don to //
translated: Thus means that it shows the example.

original: shin tu dag pas na rab tu dga' ba ste /🔽gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen pos chags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: shin tu dag pas na rab tu dga' ba ste / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen pos chags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Since it is very pure, it is the Joyful.🔽Since it is the nature of attachment by the great compassion of non-apprehension free from the discrimination of object and subject, it shows all forms from suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid las gzugs ma lus par ston pas phyi ma'i mthar thug pa'i bar du 'gro ba'i don la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gzugs ma lus par ston pas phyi ma'i mthar thug pa'i bar du 'gro ba'i don la spyod pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of the meaning of going to the end of the future.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das rab tu dga' ba ji lta bu lags zhes pa la /
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das rab tu dga' ba ji lta bu lags zhes pa la /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat said, “What is the Joyful?”

original: nyes pa med par rtag tu 'byung //
analyzed: nyes pa med par rtag tu 'byung //
translated: It is always arising without fault.

original: chags pa kun la rjes su dgyes //
analyzed: chags pa kun la rjes su dgyes //
translated: It is the delight in all attachments.

original: de nyid kyis gsang bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gsang bcom ldan 'das //
translated: By that alone, Bhagavat,

original: 'dod chags chen po dga' ba che //🔽zhes bka' stsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po dga' ba che //🔽zhes bka' stsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is the great passion, the great joy.

original: de'i de bzhin nyid du tshul gcig pa ni rnam par dag ba'o //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid du tshul gcig pa ni rnam par dag ba'o //
translated: The sameness of its suchness is its purity.

original: de'i gnas ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni bzhi ste /
translated: Its basis is fourfold:

original: de kho na nyid bcu'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bcu'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: it is the nature of the ten realities.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected to the previous verse.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad de /
translated: That is to say is a verbal particle.

original: bsdus pa'i tshig gis kha skong ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshig gis kha skong ba la 'jug go //
translated: It is used to supplement the condensed statement.

original: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag par sbyar ro //
translated: It is also connected to the perfections and the correct applications.

original: byang chub pa'i ngo bo nyid la sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes nye bar dgongs te /
analyzed: byang chub pa'i ngo bo nyid la sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes nye bar dgongs te /
translated: The bodhisattva is one whose essence is enlightenment.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the intended meaning, because it is the nature of the result.

original: de'i gnas ni sems can gdul ba'i rten no //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni sems can gdul ba'i rten no //
translated: Its basis is the support for taming sentient beings.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub kyi @69a * //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub kyi @69a * //
translated: The Bhagavān Vajrasattva, whose essence is enlightenment,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi gnas 'di ni sems can rnams 'dul ba'i rten yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi gnas 'di ni sems can rnams 'dul ba'i rten yin te /
translated: is the support for taming sentient beings.

original: rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas kyis 'dul bar bya ba rnams 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas kyis 'dul bar bya ba rnams 'dul ba'o //
translated: He is the tamer of those to be tamed by the abode of the purity of the highest joy.

original: 'dis ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas kyis rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas kyis rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this, he explains the nature of Vajrasattva by the abode of the purity of the highest joy.

original: 'dod chags ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgom pa la shin tu zhen pa'i chags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgom pa la shin tu zhen pa'i chags pa ste /
translated: Passion is the attachment of one who is very attached to the meditation on Vajrasattva, etc.

original: 'dod chags dam tshig yin par bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags dam tshig yin par bshad //
translated: Passion is explained as the pledge.

original: chos kyi 'dod pa yid 'ong ba //
analyzed: chos kyi 'dod pa yid 'ong ba //
translated: The desire for Dharma is pleasing.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dod chags nyid mda' yin pas na /
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid mda' yin pas na /
translated: Passion itself is the arrow.

original: 'dod chags kyi mda' ste phra mor 'bigs pas mda' zhes bya zhes bshad pa dang / yang rgyud 'di nyid las /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mda' ste phra mor 'bigs pas mda' zhes bya zhes bshad pa dang / yang rgyud 'di nyid las /
translated: Passion is the arrow, because it is said that it pierces subtly, and in this very tantra it is said:

original: mchog kun 'bigs pas gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: mchog kun 'bigs pas gcig pu nyid //
translated: It is the one that pierces all the best.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: His purity, etc. is as before.

original: tshig 'dis kyang rdo rje yid las byung ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'dis kyang rdo rje yid las byung ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this verse, he also teaches the meaning of Vajracaṇḍa.

original: reg pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar bsgom pa dang ldan pa la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa ni reg pa ste /🔽de skad du /
analyzed: reg pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar bsgom pa dang ldan pa la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa ni reg pa ste / de skad du /
translated: The phrase the purity of contact and so on means that the actualization of Vajrasattva and so on is contact for one who possesses such meditation.

original: bde ba thams cad dngos grub mchog / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad dngos grub mchog / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said: All bliss is the supreme attainment.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje rtse mo can gyi ngo bo nyid bshad pa yin no //🔽sdug pa'i 'ching pa rnam par dag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje rtse mo can gyi ngo bo nyid bshad pa yin no // sdug pa'i 'ching pa rnam par dag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This also explains the nature of the vajra peak.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas nas 'khor ba ji srid par yongs su mi gtong ba ni sdug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas nas 'khor ba ji srid par yongs su mi gtong ba ni sdug pa'o //
translated: The phrase the purity of the bond of beauty and so on means that the actualization of the nature of Vajrasattva and so on is beauty, since it is not abandoned for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de nyid ni 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'ching ba ste /
translated: That itself is the bond,🔽since it is said:

original: rab chags 'ching ba chu sri na 'dra //
analyzed: rab chags 'ching ba chu sri na 'dra //
translated: The bond of passion is like a crocodile,

original: des 'di chu srin rgyal mtshan no //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'di chu srin rgyal mtshan no // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and this is the crocodile banner.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma ba zhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma ba zhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje dran pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje dran pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the meaning of Vajra-mindfulness.

original: thams cad la dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thams cad la dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The mastery of all, and the control of all, and so on.

original: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su mi gtong ba'i sdug pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa'i rnal 'byor pas bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum chogs pa thams cad 'khor ba ji srid
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su mi gtong ba'i sdug pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa'i rnal 'byor pas bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum chogs pa thams cad 'khor ba ji srid
translated: Thus, the yogi bound by the beautiful bondage of not relinquishing the nature of Vajrasattva and so on, by the wisdom of accomplishing activities, holds all mundane and supramundane perfections for as long as cyclic existence

original: du 'dzin par byed pas na /
analyzed: du 'dzin par byed pas na /
translated: exists.

original: thams cad la dbang phyug dang dbang byed pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la dbang phyug dang dbang byed pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that he has the mastery of all and controls all.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje snyems ma'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje snyems ma'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: This also teaches the meaning of Vajra-pride.

original: @69b de skad du /
analyzed: @69b de skad du /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: g-yon du snyems pas dang du byed //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yon du snyems pas dang du byed // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should delight in the left.

original: des de snyems pas mtho ba'i thun mong du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des de snyems pas mtho ba'i thun mong du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that pride in that is the common pride.

original: 'dir yang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood as the essence of the perfection of effort.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji skad du gsungs pa'i 'dod chags kyi mdas chos kyi dbyings so sor rtog par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji skad du gsungs pa'i 'dod chags kyi mdas chos kyi dbyings so sor rtog par byas nas /
translated: Its essence is the essence of the gnosis of successful activity.🔽The abode of pure view, etc.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu mthong ba'i lta ba la bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu mthong ba'i lta ba la bya'o //
translated: Having penetrated the realm of phenomena with the arrow of passion as described, one should view all phenomena as selfless.

original: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: 'dis kyang sgeg mo'i don gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang sgeg mo'i don gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the meaning of grace.

original: dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The abode of pure joy, etc.

original: sdar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas pa'i reg pa rnam par dag pa las zag pa med pa'i dga' ba nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas pa'i reg pa rnam par dag pa las zag pa med pa'i dga' ba nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the pure contact that is the direct realization of the essence of Vajrasattva, etc., in the manner explained, uncontaminated joy arises.

original: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: 'dis kyang bzhad pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bzhad pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the meaning of the Vajra Laughter.

original: sred pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sred pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The abode of the purification of craving, etc.

original: rdo rje dran pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sdug pa'i 'ching ba'i ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa yongs su mi spong ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dran pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sdug pa'i 'ching ba'i ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa yongs su mi spong ba'o //
translated: The vajra is the nature of mindfulness. The fetter of beauty is the future desire that is not abandoned.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje glu mkhan ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje glu mkhan ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the meaning of the Vajra Songstress.🔽The conceit, etc.

original: snyems pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang phyug gi bdag po'i snyems pas khams gsum ma lus pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams zil gyis mnan nas rnam par snang ba ni 'dir bsnyems pa'o //
analyzed: snyems pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang phyug gi bdag po'i snyems pas khams gsum ma lus pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams zil gyis mnan nas rnam par snang ba ni 'dir bsnyems pa'o //
translated: The conceit of the lord of lords is the conceit that, having overcome the realms of sentient beings who live in the three realms, one shines forth.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje gar mkhan ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje gar mkhan ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the meaning of the Vajra Dancer.

original: rgyan rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyan rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The abode of the purification of ornaments, etc.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang bsam gtan gyi me tog gi rgyan gyis lta ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang bsam gtan gyi me tog gi rgyan gyis lta ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: The flowers of the branches of enlightenment and the meditative stabilizations are the ornament of the eye of pure vision.

original: de bas na lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the abode of the purity of vision.

original: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje me tog ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje me tog ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the meaning of Vajra-puspa.

original: yid tshim par byed pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yid tshim par byed pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The abode of the purity of the satisfaction of the mind, etc.

original: shes rab kyis chos thams cad bdag med par mthong bas dga' ba nye bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos thams cad bdag med par mthong bas dga' ba nye bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Joy arises through the vision of the selflessness of all things by means of wisdom.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdug pa ma yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdug pa ma yin par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is said to be the non-poison.

original: lhag ma rnams go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams go sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: snang ba rnam par @70a * //
analyzed: snang ba rnam par @70a * //
translated: The abode of the purity of the light of the Dharma, etc.

original: dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snang bas chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor rab tu mthong bas na chos la sred pa nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ta /
analyzed: dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snang bas chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor rab tu mthong bas na chos la sred pa nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ta /
translated: The place of purity and so forth: the perfection of vow is the appearance, since all phenomena are seen as having the nature of illusion and so forth. Thus, craving for phenomena arises.

original: des na snang ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na snang ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the place of pure appearance.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje mar me ma'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje mar me ma'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the meaning of Vajrapradīpā.

original: lus pa de ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten la 'das pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid ni lus so //
analyzed: lus pa de ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten la 'das pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid ni lus so //
translated: The place of the purity of the body and so forth: the body is the nature of the five aggregates that transcend the world.

original: de nyid ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni bde ba ste /
translated: That itself is bliss.

original: des dge ba'i snyems pa nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur te de bas na de ni 'di'i bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: des dge ba'i snyems pa nye bar 'byung bar 'gyur te de bas na de ni 'di'i bshad pa yin te /
translated: The conceit of virtue arises from that. Therefore, this is its explanation.

original: 'dis kyang rdo rje snyems ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rdo rje snyems ma'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the meaning of Vajragarvā.

original: lhag ma rnas sa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnas sa ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gdul bya rnams la gang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku yang dag par ston pa /
