analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir / gdul bya rnams la gang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku yang dag par ston pa /
translated: The place of the purity of form and so forth: in order to generate the perfection of meditative stabilization,🔽the deeds of Great Vajradhara in which he perfectly displays the body of Vajrasattva and so forth to the disciples

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos mdzad pa de ni gzugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos mdzad pa de ni gzugs so //
translated: are form.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //🔽sgra rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o // sgra rnam par dag pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The place of the purity of sound and so forth: in order to perfect the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ston par mdzad pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni sgra'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ston par mdzad pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni sgra'o //
translated: the essence of the perfection of wisdom which is the reality of the analytical knowledges, the essence of the teaching of the ten perfections, is sound.

original: gzhan dag ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go bar zad do //
translated: The others are understood.

original: dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos bdag med pa ba sgoms pas /
analyzed: dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos bdag med pa ba sgoms pas /
translated: In order to perfect the perfection of vows, one meditates on the selflessness of phenomena,

original: shes bya ma lus pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa'i grags pa'i dri gang yin pa de ni dri'o //
analyzed: shes bya ma lus pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa'i grags pa'i dri gang yin pa de ni dri'o //
translated: and the scent of fame is the knowledge of all objects of knowledge as having the nature of non-entityness.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for taste and so on,

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzi dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lus kyi bde ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzi dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lus kyi bde ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to attain the state of pure physical bliss through the nature of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation,

original: gnag sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po rang nyid kyis ston par mdzad pa de ni ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnag sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po rang nyid kyis ston par mdzad pa de ni ro zhes bya'o //
translated: the great vajra holder himself displays the expressions of dancing and so on. That is called taste.

original: lhag ma rnams ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest are understood.

original: tshig bzhi po de dag gis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje gzugs dang / rdo rje sgra dang / rdo rje dri dang rdo rje ro'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig bzhi po de dag gis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje gzugs dang / rdo rje sgra dang / rdo rje dri dang rdo rje ro'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: These four lines indicate the meaning of the vajra form, the vajra sound, the vajra smell, and the vajra taste, respectively.

original: de @70b yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de @70b yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to tame the lord of the desire realm,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos gang 'di btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du bzhugs pa'i rab tu dga' ba chen po'i skur sprul pa mdzad pa de mthong ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug de'i rang nyid kyi chung ma'i 'khor nyid la sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i blo skyes nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos gang 'di btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du bzhugs pa'i rab tu dga' ba chen po'i skur sprul pa mdzad pa de mthong ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug de'i rang nyid kyi chung ma'i 'khor nyid la sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i blo skyes nas /
translated: the Blessed One, the Great Vajra Holder, emanated as the body of great joy residing in the harem. When the lord of the desire realm saw that, he generated the thought of suffering towards his own harem,

original: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par 'dod pas phyag byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par 'dod pas phyag byas so //
translated: and with longing for the Blessed One, he made prostrations.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku 'di ni gzugs rnam par dag pa'i gnas so snyam nas /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku 'di ni gzugs rnam par dag pa'i gnas so snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, this body of the Blessed One is the abode of pure form.

original: bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar na khyed kyi gzugs phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag thob par 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / de'i phyir de gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la bkod nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar na khyed kyi gzugs phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag thob par 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / de'i phyir de gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la bkod nas /
translated: For that purpose, he established them in going for refuge and in the generation of the enlightenment mind.

original: de nyid kyi ched du bcom ldan 'das gang 'di rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa de ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ched du bcom ldan 'das gang 'di rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa de ni sgra'o //
translated: Then, for that very purpose, the Lord taught the stage of Very Joyful and so forth. That is the sound.

original: thos na kyang de'i don de la lhag par mos pa'i ye shes kyi sgra rtogs pa ni dri'o //
analyzed: thos na kyang de'i don de la lhag par mos pa'i ye shes kyi sgra rtogs pa ni dri'o //
translated: When they hear it, the understanding of the sound of the wisdom of superior aspiration for that meaning is the smell.

original: de nyid shin tu yang de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ro'o //
analyzed: de nyid shin tu yang de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ro'o //
translated: That very thing becomes its nature, which is the taste.

original: de nas kyang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gi bsam gtan mngon sum du byas pa ni rgyan no //
analyzed: de nas kyang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gi bsam gtan mngon sum du byas pa ni rgyan no //
translated: Then, the direct realization of the flower of the seven factors of enlightenment is the ornament.

original: de nas nges par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin pa khong du chud pa ni yid tshim pa'o //
analyzed: de nas nges par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin pa khong du chud pa ni yid tshim pa'o //
translated: Then, the comprehension of the perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of penetration, is the satisfaction.

original: de nas snang ba thob pa dang / snang ba mched pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa las byung ba'i bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: de nas snang ba thob pa dang / snang ba mched pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa las byung ba'i bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa ni snang ba'o //
translated: Then, the attainment of light, the expansion of light, and the realization of the essence of the uninterrupted samadhi that arises from one aspect of the meaning of reality is light.

original: de nyid kyis ni chos dang gang zag tu rtog pa'i dri ma dan bral bas na tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba thob pa ni lus bde ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni chos dang gang zag tu rtog pa'i dri ma dan bral bas na tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba thob pa ni lus bde ba'o //
translated: By that, the attainment of the purity of the stains of conceptualizing phenomena and persons is the attainment of the bliss of body, which is the attainment of morality, samadhi, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: de nas chos thams cad la bdag med pa mthong ba ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad la bdag med pa mthong ba ni lta ba'o //
translated: Then, the vision of the selflessness of all phenomena is the view.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa rab tu mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa rab tu mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The joy that arises from that is joy.

original: de nas ji ltar mthong ba'i chos bdag med pa'i ye shes yang dag yang du bsgom pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar mthong ba'i chos bdag med pa'i ye shes yang dag yang du bsgom pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Then, the repeated cultivation of the wisdom of the selflessness of phenomena as it was seen is craving.

original: bsgom pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i spros pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dregs pa ni snyems pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i spros pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dregs pa ni snyems pa'o //
translated: The pride that is associated with cultivation and has the characteristic of elaboration is conceit.

original: spro bar gyur pa de la yang nas yang du rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa ni 'dod chags kyi mda'o //
analyzed: spro bar gyur pa de la yang nas yang du rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa ni 'dod chags kyi mda'o //
translated: The arrow of passion is the repeated delight in that expansion.

original: des rab kyi mthar thug pa'i rab tu dga' ba rnam bar dag ba ni reg pa rnam par dag pa ste /🔽byang chub kyi sems @71a * //
analyzed: des rab kyi mthar thug pa'i rab tu dga' ba rnam bar dag ba ni reg pa rnam par dag pa ste / byang chub kyi sems @71a * //
translated: The purification of the highest delight is the purification of contact.🔽The bodhisattva who has attained the purification of the highest delight is one who has realized the great bliss of the bodhisattva stages.

original: bde ba chen po la sogs pa mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba chen po la sogs pa mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he has realized the great bliss of the bodhisattva stages.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa mngon sum du byas nas yongs su mi gtong bar nus pa ni sdug pa'i 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa mngon sum du byas nas yongs su mi gtong bar nus pa ni sdug pa'i 'ching ba'o //
translated: The bond of beauty is the ability to not abandon the realization of the bodhisattva stages and so on.

original: des kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba las rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par grol ba thob cing lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i lam la gnas pa thob bas thams cad la dbang phyug dang dbang ba nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: des kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba las rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par grol ba thob cing lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i lam la gnas pa thob bas thams cad la dbang phyug dang dbang ba nyid thob pa ste /
translated: By that, he attains liberation, which is naturally radiant, from the fetters of subject and object, and attains the state of engaging the path spontaneously.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po'i gtso bos brgyan pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po'i gtso bos brgyan pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa ni /
translated: The lord who is adorned with the chief of supreme bliss.🔽

original: rab tu dga' ba'i bar du rgyud la gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i bar du rgyud la gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The lord who is adorned with the chief of the great bliss of supreme joy is taught in the tantra in the context of the supreme joy.

original: 'di ltar ston par mdzad pa ni yul spangs pas thar pa thob bar 'dod pas skrag pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ston par mdzad pa ni yul spangs pas thar pa thob bar 'dod pas skrag pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the teaching is for those who are frightened by the assertion that liberation is attained by abandoning objects.

original: de rnams kyi 'khor ba'i mi rtag pa'i gzugs spangs nas 'di na lta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs thob ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'khor ba'i mi rtag pa'i gzugs spangs nas 'di na lta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs thob ste /
translated: For them, having abandoned the impermanent forms of cyclic existence, they attain forms that are delightful to behold.

original: bde ba chen po rjes su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar nges par dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba chen po rjes su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar nges par dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They will experience great bliss.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One teaches the form that is explained in this way.

original: gzugs 'di ni pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra med par bde ba chen po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra med par bde ba chen po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This form does not arise as great bliss without the sound of the lute, and so on.

original: de bas na pi wang brdungs pa la sogs pas sgra ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na pi wang brdungs pa la sogs pas sgra ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he teaches the sound of the lute, and so on.

original: dri med par yang ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri med par yang ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is neither pure nor impure,

original: phyag na dri'i snod bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na dri'i snod bsnams pa'o //
translated: he holds a perfume container in his hand.

original: de yang ro'i snod med par ma yin pas de'i phyir phyag na ro'i snod bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ro'i snod med par ma yin pas de'i phyir phyag na ro'i snod bsnams pa'o //
translated: And that is not without a taste container, therefore he holds a taste container in his hand.

original: me tog gi rgyan med par yang de bzhin te de bas na phyag thal mo spyar bas me tog bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gi rgyan med par yang de bzhin te de bas na phyag thal mo spyar bas me tog bsnams pa'o //
translated: It is also like that without a flower ornament, therefore he holds a flower in his joined palms.

original: de yang bdug spos med par yid tshim par mi 'gyur bas spos khang 'dzin pa'i phyag gis spos khang bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bdug spos med par yid tshim par mi 'gyur bas spos khang 'dzin pa'i phyag gis spos khang bsnams pa'o //
translated: And that is not without incense, therefore he holds an incense container in his hand.

original: de bzhin du mun nag tu ni phan tshun mthong ba med pas de'i phyir mar me bsnams par mdzad pa ni mar me'o //🔽de yang dri'i byug pa med bar lus bde bar mi 'gyur bas dud chos kyi phyag gis dri bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mun nag tu ni phan tshun mthong ba med pas de'i phyir mar me bsnams par mdzad pa ni mar me'o // de yang dri'i byug pa med bar lus bde bar mi 'gyur bas dud chos kyi phyag gis dri bsnams pa'o //
translated: And in the dark, they do not see each other, therefore he holds a lamp, which is a lamp.🔽And that is not without scented ointment, therefore he holds a scent in his hand.

original: rnam par sgeg ma dang bral bas rab tu dga' bas bde ba chen po 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rnam par sgeg ma dang bral bas rab tu dga' bas bde ba chen po 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Without a dancing girl, great bliss does not arise from intense joy, therefore he holds a musical instrument in his hand.

original: de'i phyir sgeg ma dang bzhad pa dang / glu chen po dang / gar rnams byed pas rnam par sgeg par go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mig dga' ba'i sdug pa dang / lta @71b ba dang mig gi chags pa dang / dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgeg ma dang bzhad pa dang / glu chen po dang / gar rnams byed pas rnam par sgeg par go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mig dga' ba'i sdug pa dang / lta @71b ba dang mig gi chags pa dang / dga' ba dang /
translated: Therefore, the goddesses of charm, laughter, great song, and dance are the charm of the eyes, the gaze, the passion of the eyes, and the delight of the eyes, respectively.

original: mig gi chags pa'i sred pa dang / mig gi chags pa 'byung ba'i spro ba'i snyems pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston te 'di dag kyang gzhan ma yin par gyur pa nyid ni 'khyud par byed pa yin zhing nam yang yongs su mi spong ste /
analyzed: mig gi chags pa'i sred pa dang / mig gi chags pa 'byung ba'i spro ba'i snyems pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston te 'di dag kyang gzhan ma yin par gyur pa nyid ni 'khyud par byed pa yin zhing nam yang yongs su mi spong ste /
translated: They are the nature of the conceit of the passion of the eyes, the craving of the passion of the eyes, and the delight of the passion of the eyes. They are not different from the embrace, which is never abandoned.

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad pa 'di rnams la dbang brnyes pa nyid bsten pa nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad pa 'di rnams la dbang brnyes pa nyid bsten pa nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, the great bliss of supreme joy arises by relying on the mastery of these aspects.

original: 'dod chags kyi mda' dang reg pa dang / sdug pa'i 'chang ba dang bdag por gyur pa'i gnas kyi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mda' dang reg pa dang / sdug pa'i 'chang ba dang bdag por gyur pa'i gnas kyi bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the abode of the arrow of passion, touch, and the bearer of beauty.

original: de skad du yul spangs pas thar pa thob par 'dod pas skrag pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽mdo las / brin d'a'i gnas ni nyams dga' bas //
analyzed: de skad du yul spangs pas thar pa thob par 'dod pas skrag pa zhes bya ba'o // mdo las / brin d'a'i gnas ni nyams dga' bas //
translated: Thus, it is called “the fear of those who assert that liberation is attained by abandoning objects.”🔽A sutra states:🔽Even if one becomes a fox,🔽the delightful abode of Bhrgupatra

original: wa nyid gyur kyang mchog yin gyis //🔽goo ta ma yum rnams spangs pa yi //
analyzed: wa nyid gyur kyang mchog yin gyis // goo ta ma yum rnams spangs pa yi //
translated: is supreme.🔽I never seek liberation

original: thar pa nam yang mi 'tshal lo //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thar pa nam yang mi 'tshal lo // zhes gsungs te /
translated: by abandoning the mothers of Gautama.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For that reason, this abode of the purity of the stage of joy is the abode of the bodhisattva, and so on up to:🔽this abode of the purity of taste is the abode of the bodhisattva.

original: ro rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes rgyu gsungs pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rab tu dga' ba nas /
analyzed: ro rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes rgyu gsungs pa yin no // de bzhin du chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rab tu dga' ba nas /
translated: Thus, the cause is stated.🔽Similarly, all phenomena are naturally pure.

original: ro'i mthar thug pa'i chos thams cad ni don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ro'i mthar thug pa'i chos thams cad ni don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because all phenomena, from the stage of joy up to the stage of taste, are ultimately free from the conceptualization of grasped and grasper.

original: de bas na rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the abode of the purity of the Joyous is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba nas /🔽de bzhin su ji srid du ro rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas kyang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba nas / de bzhin su ji srid du ro rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas kyang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor
translated: the abode of the bodhisattva, and so on up to:🔽the abode of the bodhisattva is the abode of the purity of taste.

original: pa rnams kyis khong du chud par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de dag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa rnams kyis khong du chud par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de dag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by the purity of the perfection of wisdom, the purity of the Joyous and so on is taught, in order to demonstrate that the yogis should understand them, and not otherwise.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to all phenomena and so on,

original: chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas chos thams cad de /
analyzed: chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas chos thams cad de /
translated: they are all phenomena because they are phenomena and all.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rab tu dga' ba'i rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rab tu dga' ba'i rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the Joyous and so on, which are explained as pure.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par dag pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings te de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par dag pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings te de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The purity of the reality of those is the beginningless and endless ultimate realm, which is the meaning of thusness.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad rnam par @72a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad rnam par @72a * //
translated: All phenomena of that kind are the cause of purity,

original: dag pa'i rgyur gyur pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i rgyur gyur pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and thus the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: 'dir shes rab ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Here, wisdom is the characteristic of the thorough analysis of all phenomena that are pure, such as the Joyous.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni son pa ste /
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni son pa ste /
translated: Its perfection is its arrival,

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa khong du chud pa mngon sum du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa khong du chud pa mngon sum du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: which is the nature of the realization of the purity of the Joyous and so forth.

original: de yang chos thams cad dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang dbyer mi phyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang dbyer mi phyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, it means that it is inseparable from the naturally pure dharmadhatu, the beginningless and endless reality free from all stains.

original: yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa lta bu'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa lta bu'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Completely pure means free from all conceptual thoughts together with their habitual tendencies, such as those of the three realms.

original: 'dis ni don 'di ston par 'gyur ba yin te /🔽gang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni don 'di ston par 'gyur ba yin te / gang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: This shows the meaning of the following.🔽The purity of the stages of joy and so on is the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The purity of the perfection of wisdom is the purity of the stages of joy and so on.

original: de ltar yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon sum du byas pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon sum du byas pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Since that is the case, by actualizing the perfection of wisdom, one attains the purity of the Joyous and so on,

original: tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of an undifferentiated nature.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad nas de la nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams spro ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir lag na rdo rje su la las zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i phan yon gsungs pa
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad nas de la nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams spro ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir lag na rdo rje su la las zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i phan yon gsungs pa
translated: Having explained the perfection of wisdom in that way, in order to generate enthusiasm in those who possess listening, reflection, and so on with respect to that, the benefits of that are stated by Vajrapani with the words, “Vajrapani, whoever…”🔽and so on.

original: yin te / lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: yin te / lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: Vajrapani is the speaker.

original: su la las zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i tshul gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: su la las zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i tshul gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Whoever is stated in the ordinary way of a male or female and so on.

original: chos thams cad ji skad du bshad pa'i rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ji skad du bshad pa'i rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are the Joyous and so on, as previously explained.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i sgo ni de'i gnas kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i sgo ni de'i gnas kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: The door to the purity of their reality is the mandala of its location, and so forth.

original: de'i bsgrub pa ni gang gis mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bsgrub pa ni gang gis mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Its accomplishment is that by which one will realize it.

original: de la ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i sgo bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the accomplishment of the door to the purity of the reality of all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: The method of the perfection of wisdom is the reality of the purity of the Joyful, and so forth, as explained.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rab tu dga' ba la @72b sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid gtso bor smos pa gzung ba'i tshul gyis blo la gzhag nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rab tu dga' ba la @72b sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid gtso bor smos pa gzung ba'i tshul gyis blo la gzhag nas smras pa'o //
translated: Here refers to the just-explained reality of the purity of the Joyful, and so forth, which is mentioned as the main point. Having set it in the mind by way of apprehending it, he said, Here, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who wants to fully know the perfection of wisdom should thus train.

original: lan cig thos na yang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i tshul lan cig kho na'o //
analyzed: lan cig thos na yang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i tshul lan cig kho na'o //
translated: Having heard it just once means that such a method is just once.

original: thos pa ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas bzung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas bzung ba'o //
translated: Having heard means having apprehended it with the knowledge that has the nature of hearing.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gang gis yang dang yang du thos pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes ston to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gang gis yang dang yang du thos pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it goes without saying that one who hears it again and again will not be reborn in the hells.

original: de byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po de thos pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po de thos pa nas brtsams te /
translated: “Until the seat of awakening” means that, beginning with the hearing,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par ma gyur kyang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par ma gyur kyang /
translated: even if that listener does not attain complete and supreme awakening,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa thams cad la sogs pa nye bar bsags pas /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa thams cad la sogs pa nye bar bsags pas /
translated: by accumulating the accumulations of all the obscurations and so forth as they have been explained,

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs par nam yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs par nam yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: he will never be reborn in the hells and so forth.

original: sgrib pa thams cad de zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad de zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “All the obscurations” is the statement.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: de la 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ste /
translated: Among them, desire for sense objects, malice, sleep, lethargy, excitement, regret, and doubt.

original: sgrib pa de rnams chen po 'dod chags la sogs pas phye ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //🔽'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa de rnams chen po 'dod chags la sogs pas phye ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o // 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa /
translated: Those obscurations are the afflictive obscurations, which are the afflictions such as attachment that are distinguished by great attachment, etc.

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i las ni chos kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i las ni chos kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: They are the obscurations of the Dharma, which are actions such as abandoning the true Dharma, that are obstacles to the arising of the noble path.

original: mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa ni las kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa ni las kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: They are the obscurations of karma, which are the five heinous actions, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa de dag nyid kyi che ba ni chen po'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa de dag nyid kyi che ba ni chen po'o //
translated: The greatness of those very obscurations that have been explained is great.

original: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las rnams byas nas mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las rnams byas nas mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Accumulated means that after one has performed the actions that have the characteristics of the obscurations that have been explained, one delights in the preparatory, actual and concluding stages.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni shin tu che ba dang chung ba dang / 'bring tsam du bsags pa'i sgrib pas shin tu yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni shin tu che ba dang chung ba dang / 'bring tsam du bsags pa'i sgrib pas shin tu yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: The word also indicates that one does not go to the lower realms even by the great, middling and small accumulations of obscurations.

original: sems can dmyal bal sogs pa zhes bya bas ni mnar med pa la sogs pa dmyal ba chen po brgyad dang / nye 'khor ba rnams ni dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bal sogs pa zhes bya bas ni mnar med pa la sogs pa dmyal ba chen po brgyad dang / nye 'khor ba rnams ni dmyal ba'o //
translated: The words “such as the hells” refer to the hells, the eight great hells such as the Avici Hell, and the neighboring hells.

original: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan song rnams te /
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan song rnams te /
translated: Those that are such as the hells are the evil destinies such as the hells.

original: yi dags rnams dang dud 'gro rnams so //
analyzed: yi dags rnams dang dud 'gro rnams so //
translated: They are the hungry ghosts and the animals.

original: de ltar na dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song de rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song de rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one will not be born in those evil destinies such as the hells.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Never” means by no means at all.

original: sdig pa yang @73a * //
analyzed: sdig pa yang @73a * //
translated: “Evil” means

original: byas ma thag tu sdug bsngal med par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa thams cad sbyong ba dang / dngos gzhi'i las kyi ngo bo byas ma thag tu zhes pa de rnams byas pa tsam gyis sdug bsngal med par zhes pa sdug bsngal med cing rims la sogs pa'i gnod pa ma byas par de rnams zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byas ma thag tu sdug bsngal med par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa thams cad sbyong ba dang / dngos gzhi'i las kyi ngo bo byas ma thag tu zhes pa de rnams byas pa tsam gyis sdug bsngal med par zhes pa sdug bsngal med cing rims la sogs pa'i gnod pa ma byas par de rnams zad par 'gyur la /
translated: This shows that as soon as one performs the essential actions of the main practice, which purify all obscurations, they will be purified without suffering, without the harm of disease and so on.

original: bsags pa rnams kyang rims la sogs pa'i gnod pa mi byed do zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bsags pa rnams kyang rims la sogs pa'i gnod pa mi byed do zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: And even those that have been accumulated will not be harmed by disease and so on.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur ba yin te ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa rnams da ltar gyi tshe 'di la chen po la sogs pa byas shing /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur ba yin te ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrib pa rnams da ltar gyi tshe 'di la chen po la sogs pa byas shing /
translated: This is what is being taught: The obscurations explained above, which have been committed in this present life, whether great or small,🔽and which one has delighted in,

original: mngon par dga' ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos nas /🔽de'i rims la sogs pa gnod pa bskyed pa de rnams zad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos nas / de'i rims la sogs pa gnod pa bskyed pa de rnams zad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: will be exhausted upon hearing the perfection of wisdom.

original: byas ma thag tu yang sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas ma thag tu yang sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And as soon as they are performed, they will be purified without suffering.

original: su zhig 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzhung dang don gyi tshul mi brjed pa'i sbyor bas sems la yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: su zhig 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzhung dang don gyi tshul mi brjed pa'i sbyor bas sems la yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
translated: One who holds means one who correctly places the mind by the application of not forgetting the manner of the text and its meaning.

original: nyin re zhing klog pa dang zhes bya ba ni yid ma yang dag par blangs nas nyin re zhing glegs bam du byas nas klog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyin re zhing klog pa dang zhes bya ba ni yid ma yang dag par blangs nas nyin re zhing glegs bam du byas nas klog par byed pa'o //
translated: One who reads every day means one who, having taken it up properly, reads it every day in the form of a book.

original: kha ton du byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig tu bzung nas yang dang yang du sbyor zhing 'don pa ni kha ton du byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha ton du byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig tu bzung nas yang dang yang du sbyor zhing 'don pa ni kha ton du byed pa'o //
translated: One who recites and so on means one who, having grasped the words, repeatedly applies and recites them.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni thos nas sems pa dang sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni thos nas sems pa dang sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Proper mental attention means reflecting and meditating after hearing.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshul bzhin nam yid la byed pa zhas rnam par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshul bzhin nam yid la byed pa zhas rnam par brtag pa'o //
translated: The word or is to be analyzed as or mental attention.

original: de tshe 'di nyid la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos la'o //
analyzed: de tshe 'di nyid la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos la'o //
translated: At that time, in this very life means in the present life.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All dharmas means the stages of joy and so on.

original: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni ji skad du bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni ji skad du bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of those is just as explained.

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The one-pointed mind that has that as its object is the vajra samādhi.

original: de 'thob pa ni rnyed par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de 'thob pa ni rnyed par gyur pa ste /
translated: The attainment of that is the acquisition.

original: de thob pas chos thams cad la dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de thob pas chos thams cad la dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: By attaining that, one becomes a master of all phenomena.

original: de nyid ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa mngon sum du byed pa la mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa mngon sum du byed pa la mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That itself becomes the mastery of actualizing the purities of the Joyful and so on.

original: de yang dngos su na gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan gyi dbang dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dngos su na gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan gyi dbang dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, in actuality, one becomes free from the power of the other, the conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa las thob par gyur pa'i skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa las thob par gyur pa'i skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: In the first moment of the attainment of all phenomena and so on, that which arises is joy.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa ni mgu ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa ni mgu ba'o //
translated: In the second moment, that which arises is supreme joy.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par skyes pa ni mchog tu @73b dga' ba ste thams cad la dga' ba dang mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dag ni dga' ba dang mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dag ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par skyes pa ni mchog tu @73b dga' ba ste thams cad la dga' ba dang mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dag ni dga' ba dang mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dag ste /
translated: In the third moment and so forth, one is born as supreme joy, which is joy, delight, and supreme joy in all.

original: de rnams myong bar 'gyur zhing mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams myong bar 'gyur zhing mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One experiences and actualizes those.

original: rdo rje gzugs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rdo rje gzugs nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the vajra form

original: rdo rje snyems pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug ni byang chub chen po'i sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snyems pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug ni byang chub chen po'i sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: and ending with the vajra conceit, the sixteen bodhisattvas are great bodhisattvas, because they are the essence of the mind of great enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyi tshe ni rnal 'byor pas de'i rang bzhin mngon par rtogs nas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshe ni rnal 'byor pas de'i rang bzhin mngon par rtogs nas /
translated: The life of those is the life of the yogin who realizes their nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag gi tshe bcu drug gis chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang bcas pa'i rgyur gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag gi tshe bcu drug gis chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang bcas pa'i rgyur gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The life of those great bodhisattvas is the cause for attaining the vajra samādhi of the equality of all phenomena in sixteen moments, and thus they attain the state of a tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i dus gsum du gshegs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i dus gsum du gshegs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin la /
translated: The Bhagavans Vairocana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, and so on, equal to the atoms of all world systems, who have gone to bliss in the three times, are Tathagatas.

original: de rnams su 'gyur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams su 'gyur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid de /
translated: And that which is their nature is Tathagatahood.

original: de ni ji skad du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i rkyen gyis thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ji skad du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i rkyen gyis thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is attained by the condition of attaining the samadhi as it has been explained.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid ces bya ba la rdo rje ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid ces bya ba la rdo rje ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: As for Vajradharahood, the vajra is thusness.

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa ste ;
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa ste ;
translated: Because he holds that, he is the Vajra Holder,

original: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: who is Vajrasattva, the nature of non-duality.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The form of the Great Seal, which arises from the cause of that, is also called Vajradhara.

original: der gyur pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid de /
analyzed: der gyur pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid de /
translated: That is Vajradhara himself.

original: de thob par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de thob par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: One will attain that.

original: de la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya pa nas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ni thabs kyi phyogs gcig dang / dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin yang bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya pa nas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ni thabs kyi phyogs gcig dang / dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin yang bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the explanation from “Thus have I heard” up to “the state of Great Vajradhara” explains one part of the method and the samādhi of the initial union.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid smras so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid smras so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Then the Lord spoke of the reality of his maṇḍala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa'i sgra'i don ston pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa'i sgra'i don ston pa ste /
translated: The word “then” shows the meaning of the immediately following word.

original: dang po sbyor ba'i rjes thogs nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i rjes thogs nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “immediately after the initial union.”

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The “Lord” has been explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The Mahāyāna of all tathāgatas is the path of the bodhisattva together with its result.

original: de mngon par rtogs pa ni khong du chud pa'i rtogs pa gang la @74a * //
analyzed: de mngon par rtogs pa ni khong du chud pa'i rtogs pa gang la @74a * //
translated: The realization of that is the realization of comprehension.🔽

original: yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He who has realized that is the one who has the realization of understanding, and he is called Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid ni dkyil 'khor thams cad pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni dkyil 'khor thams cad pa ste /
translated: He is the one who is the nature of all mandalas,

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad gang yin pa de ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad gang yin pa de ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: because he is the one who is all mandalas, both mundane and supramundane.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid rdo rje dang po'i byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i bar du dga' ba'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid rdo rje dang po'i byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i bar du dga' ba'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the nature of the mandala of Vajra Delight up to the consecration of the Blessed One, Vajrasattva, the reality of the great commitment, the first vajra.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra means the vajra of the body, speech, and mind of all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: dbyings ni rgyu ste skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbyings ni rgyu ste skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: Realm is the cause, the cause that generates.

original: mtha' dag ni ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' dag ni ma lus pa ste /
translated: All means without exception.

original: de gang yin pa de ni rdo rje dbyings mtha' dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gang yin pa de ni rdo rje dbyings mtha' dag ces bya ste /
translated: That which is that is called the all-pervading vajra realm.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of Vairochana.

original: de dag gi sems dpa'i mchog ni gtso bo'i dam pa ste rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag gi sems dpa'i mchog ni gtso bo'i dam pa ste rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The best of their heroes is the best of the chief ones, Vairochana.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid yin par bshad do //
translated: This also explains that the Blessed Vajrasattva is the essence of the mandala of Vairochana.

original: khams gsum mtha' dag na zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum du gang gnas pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum mtha' dag na zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum du gang gnas pa ste /
translated: The entire three realms means those who dwell in the three realms of the ten directions.

original: der 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa ni sa bla'i 'jig rten dang / bar snang gi 'jig rten dang / mtho ris pa'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: der 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa ni sa bla'i 'jig rten dang / bar snang gi 'jig rten dang / mtho ris pa'i 'jig rten no //
translated: There, the three worlds are the earth world, the sky world, and the heaven world.

original: der rnam par rgyal ba gang yod pa de ni khams gsum po mtha' dag na 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje h'um mdzad do //
analyzed: der rnam par rgyal ba gang yod pa de ni khams gsum po mtha' dag na 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje h'um mdzad do //
translated: The one who is victorious there is the one who is victorious over the entire three realms, the three worlds without exception, the Blessed Vajra Humkara.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje rigs kyi ngo bo nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje rigs kyi ngo bo nyid du bshad do //
translated: This explains that the Blessed One Vajrasattva is the essence of the Vajra Family.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //🔽de gang gis 'dul zhing lung dang rtogs pa rab tu bzhag pa gang yin pa de la ni 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to // de gang gis 'dul zhing lung dang rtogs pa rab tu bzhag pa gang yin pa de la ni 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: The realm of sentient beings without exception and without remainder has been explained.🔽That which is the realm of sentient beings without exception and without remainder is the realm of sentient beings without exception and without remainder.🔽That which is the realm of sentient beings without exception and without remainder is the realm of sentient beings without exception and without remainder.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that the Blessed One Vajrasattva is the essence of the mandala of the subjugation of migrating beings.

original: don thams cad ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ston to //
analyzed: don thams cad ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ston to //
translated: All aims are taught to be mundane and supramundane aims.

original: de grub pa gang yin pa de ni don thams cad grub pa ste /
analyzed: de grub pa gang yin pa de ni don thams cad grub pa ste /
translated: That which is the accomplishment of those is the accomplishment of all aims.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: It is the noble Ākāśagarbha.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bo nyid yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bo nyid yin par bshad do //
translated: This explains that the Blessed One Vajrasattva is the essence of the Jewel Family.

original: lag na rdo rje thams cad pa //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje thams cad pa //
translated: Vajrapāṇi is all-pervading.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: lag na rdo rje @74b yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas lag na rdo rje thams cad de rigs lhag ma rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje @74b yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas lag na rdo rje thams cad de rigs lhag ma rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He is Vajrapāṇi, and he is all of them, so he is all Vajrapāṇis, who reside in the maṇḍalas of the remaining clans.

original: 'dis kyang bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i lhag ma rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i lhag ma rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains that he is the essence of the remaining maṇḍalas, etc.

original: du ma ni gcig ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: du ma ni gcig ma yin pa ste /
translated: Many means not one.

original: rdo rje gtsug tor dang / rdo rje mdzod spu dang / rig pa mchog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor dang / rdo rje mdzod spu dang / rig pa mchog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vajroṣṇīṣa, Vajrāmala, and Vajra-Agni are the supreme knowledge, etc.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje rigs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje gsang ba'i sems can chen pos g-yog byas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje rigs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rdo rje gsang ba'i sems can chen pos g-yog byas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: He is the essence of the Vajra clan, and he is the great being of the Vajra Secret, who is attended by those who are called by that name.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: He is Great Vajradhara.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyi don 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i gnas bcu bdun ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyi don 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i gnas bcu bdun ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul lo //
translated: This meaning of the Perfection of Wisdom method is the seventeen stages of the purity of the Joyful, etc. The Perfection of Wisdom method is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i don ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i don ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The meaning of that is the essence of the support and the supported, the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva.

original: ston te zhes bya ba ni sprul nas rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ston te zhes bya ba ni sprul nas rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: “Displaying” means having emanated, he displays.

original: bzhin rab tu 'dzum zhing zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: bzhin rab tu 'dzum zhing zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: “With a very smiling face” is self-evident.

original: lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje bsgyings te zhes bya ba la dril bu dang bcas pa'i g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur ni lag pa g-yon pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje bsgyings te zhes bya ba la dril bu dang bcas pa'i g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur ni lag pa g-yon pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: “With the left hand extended in the vajra fist” — the left vajra fist with a bell is the left hand vajra.

original: de kha nang du bstan nas g-yon pa'i rked pa'i phyogs su bkan te 'jog pa ni lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje bsgyings pa'o //
analyzed: de kha nang du bstan nas g-yon pa'i rked pa'i phyogs su bkan te 'jog pa ni lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje bsgyings pa'o //
translated: Turning it inward, it is placed on the left hip; this is the left hand extended in the vajra fist.

original: de thog ma'i rdo rje chen po zhes bya ba ni gang dum bu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud las byung ba'o ;
analyzed: de thog ma'i rdo rje chen po zhes bya ba ni gang dum bu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud las byung ba'o ;
translated: “That is the great original vajra” is that which arises in the root tantra in two sections.

original: / gsor bas ni phyag g-yas pas ji skad du bshad pa'i rdo rje nye bar 'phen pa ste /
analyzed: / gsor bas ni phyag g-yas pas ji skad du bshad pa'i rdo rje nye bar 'phen pa ste /
translated: “Shaking” is the right hand throwing the vajra as explained,

original: gsor bar gyur cing g-yon pa'i rdo rje bsgyings pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gsor bar gyur cing g-yon pa'i rdo rje bsgyings pas gnas pa'o //
translated: shaking, and remaining with the left hand extended in the vajra fist.

original: rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su ba dan gyi gung mo'i sor mo la rdo rje rtse mo gyen du bstod par bzhag pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su ba dan gyi gung mo'i sor mo la rdo rje rtse mo gyen du bstod par bzhag pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One should hold it at one’s heart in the manner of praise, means that one should hold it at the region of one’s heart in the manner of placing the vajra-peak upward on the finger of the banner’s flagpole.

original: bde ba chen po yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas na bde ba chen po rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas na bde ba chen po rdo rje'o //
translated: Since it is great bliss and also a vajra, it is the great bliss vajra.

original: de nyid don yod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid don yod pa ste /
translated: That itself is the Amogha,

original: dngos grub thams cad mi zad par stsol bar byed pa /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad mi zad par stsol bar byed pa /
translated: which bestows all powers inexhaustibly.

original: slu ba med pa rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slu ba med pa rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the undeceiving maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, is the meaning.

original: de'i dam tshig ni rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu ste ;
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu ste ;
translated: Its commitment is the cause of completion.

original: de skad ces bya ba de nyid kyi ming gang la yod pa de ni bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba de nyid kyi ming gang la yod pa de ni bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the name of that called the great bliss vajra Amogha commitment,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i rang gi snying po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i rang gi snying po'o //
translated: is the essence of the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, the cause of generating the maṇḍala.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la bzhag pa'o //
translated: This is what is placed in the mind.

original: smras so zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: smras so zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: Said is what was spoken.

original: de yang h'um zhes @75a * //🔽bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang h'um zhes @75a * // bya ba ste /
translated: That is hum.

original: rang gi yang yin la /
analyzed: rang gi yang yin la /
translated: It is one's own

original: de kho na nyid kyang yin pas na rang gi de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang yin pas na rang gi de kho na nyid de /
translated: and it is reality, thus it is one's own reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i ji skad bshad pa'i de kho na nyid bcu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i ji skad bshad pa'i de kho na nyid bcu'o //
translated: It is the ten realities of the Blessed One Vajrasattva as they have been explained.

original: de rnams kyi snying po der ni nges pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po der ni nges pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The essence of those is the definitive pristine awareness.

original: de ston par byad pa'i sgra la yang nye bar gdags pas da skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: de ston par byad pa'i sgra la yang nye bar gdags pas da skad ces bya'o ;
translated: Since it is also the sound that teaches that, it is called hum.

original: / de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: / de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: Then, as soon as this was said is self-evident.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: All the tathagatas and the vajra holders is self-evident.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po na sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po na sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //
translated: All the world systems are the buddhafields with buddhas in the great trichiliocosm.

original: khams gsum thams cad ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khams gsum thams cad do //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khams gsum thams cad do //
translated: All the three realms are all the three realms characterized by desire, form, and the formless.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams de dag thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams de dag thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bkug nas /
translated: Thus, having summoned all the Tathagatas from all those world realms,

original: ji srid du 'grub kyi bar du zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'grub kyi bar du zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: one should summon them as long as one is successful.

original: rjes su mnyes pa brtan pos mnyes par byas nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'gugs par rnam par sems rtse gcig tu byas pa na rjes su mnyes par bya ba brtan po ste /
analyzed: rjes su mnyes pa brtan pos mnyes par byas nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'gugs par rnam par sems rtse gcig tu byas pa na rjes su mnyes par bya ba brtan po ste /
translated: Having pleased them with firm devotion, means that when one has made one's mind one-pointed in summoning all the Tathagatas, one should have firm devotion.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod chags dam tshig yin par bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags dam tshig yin par bshad //
translated: Attachment is explained as commitment.

original: chos kyi 'dod pa yid du 'ong //
analyzed: chos kyi 'dod pa yid du 'ong //
translated: The desire for Dharma is pleasing.

original: de yi rjes chags sgrub sbyor bas //
analyzed: de yi rjes chags sgrub sbyor bas //
translated: The practice of attachment to that

original: rjes su chags pa zhes bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa zhes bshad do // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is explained as attachment.

original: des mnyes par byas pa ni dgyes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: des mnyes par byas pa ni dgyes par byas pa'o //
translated: Thus, having pleased them means having delighted them.

original: bkug pa ni drangs pa'o //
analyzed: bkug pa ni drangs pa'o //
translated: Summoned means drawn.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i dkyil 'khor chen por bcug ste zhes bya ba ni gang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad bskul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i dkyil 'khor chen por bcug ste zhes bya ba ni gang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad bskul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having been admitted into the great mandala of the Bhagavat Vairocana means that the Bhagavat Vajrasattva was urged to become Vairocana.

original: dkyil 'khor sprul par mdzad pa de ni 'dir rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor chen po der rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gnas su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sprul par mdzad pa de ni 'dir rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor chen po der rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gnas su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The emanation of the mandala is here the mandala of Vairocana. In that great mandala, Vajrasattva and so on are situated in the places of Vajrasattva and so on in the form of Vajrasattva and so on.

original: dam tshig gis bcings nas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyi rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir rab tu bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gis bcings nas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyi rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la sogs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir rab tu bzhag pa'o //
translated: The phrase having been bound by pledge means that they were placed there in order to accomplish the purification of the stage of joy and so on in the form of the great seal of Vajrasattva and so on.

original: de skad du phyag rgya la sogs pa dam tshig bshad ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du phyag rgya la sogs pa dam tshig bshad ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said, The pledge of the seal and so on is explained.

original: dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad rnam par @75b spyang bar bya ba'i phyir bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis rang dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad rnam par @75b spyang bar bya ba'i phyir bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis rang dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: “Having brought under one’s control” means that, in order to purify all sentient beings, one brings them under one’s control with the gnosis of successful activity.

original: dngos grub thams cad grub po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje ro'i bar gyi dngos grub thams cad kyi rgyud rdzogs pa ni dngos grub thams cad la grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad grub po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje ro'i bar gyi dngos grub thams cad kyi rgyud rdzogs pa ni dngos grub thams cad la grub pa'o //
translated: “Having accomplished all powers” means that the continuum of all powers, from Vajrasattva up to Vajra-corpse, is complete, which is the accomplishment of all powers.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Then” is as before.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: “The Blessed One” is easy to understand.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba bde ba chen po ste /
translated: The nondual mind and mental factors of great bliss, free from the afflictions together with their traces,

original: mi 'gyur bde ba'i dngos grub kun //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bde ba'i dngos grub kun //
translated: is all the powers of unchanging bliss,

original: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i thar pa la ni ;
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do // zhes gsungs pa'i thar pa la ni ;
translated: explained as “great bliss.”

original: bde ba chen po'i sgrar rgyud phyi ma las gsungs te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i sgrar rgyud phyi ma las gsungs te /
translated: In the Tantra of the Later Tantra, liberation is explained with the word “great bliss.”

original: de'i phyir rdo rje snyems pa'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje snyems pa'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the mudra of Vajragarbha.

original: de ni de las byung bas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: de ni de las byung bas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: Since it arises from that, it is the great mudra of the Bhagavān Vajrasattva.

original: de bcings nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de bcings nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa ste /
translated: Having bound that, he entered into the meditative absorption called the vajra secret of all tathāgatas, and so abided as Vairocana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The secret of all tathāgatas is the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva.

original: de la dmigs pa ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i thugs rtse gcig pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i thugs rtse gcig pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The one-pointed mind that focuses on that, which is indivisible like a vajra, is the meditative absorption called the vajra secret of all tathāgatas.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas bzhugs so zhes ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas bzhugs so zhes ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Having entered into that, he abided, having made his mind one-pointed in the form of the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning with “the bhagavat,”

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas dkyil 'khor gyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du phyag rgya'i ye shes kyi phyogs gcig kyang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas dkyil 'khor gyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du phyag rgya'i ye shes kyi phyogs gcig kyang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to “entered into the samadhi and remained there,” the second samadhi called “supreme mandala” is taught, and likewise, one part of the knowledge of the seal is also taught.

original: de nas 'dus pa mdzad pa la sogs pa ni las kyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dus pa mdzad pa la sogs pa ni las kyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the assembly and so forth should be known as the third samadhi called “supreme activity.”

original: de ltar thabs kyi ngo bo nyid ting nge 'dzin gsum pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar thabs kyi ngo bo nyid ting nge 'dzin gsum pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the three samadhis that are the nature of the method,

original: da ni dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams kyis thabs de la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams kyis thabs de la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the meaning of “those who have obtained the samayas and empowerment should enter that method,”

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis slob dpon gyi las rnams dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs pa @76a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis slob dpon gyi las rnams dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs pa @76a * //
translated: are taught.

original: yin no // de nas zhes bya ba'i skra ni 'das ma thag pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yin no // de nas zhes bya ba'i skra ni 'das ma thag pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word then is a term for immediately after;

original: dam tshig gsum gyi rjes thogs nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi rjes thogs nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means immediately after the three pledges.

original: rdo rje gsang ba yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na rdo rje gsang ba chen po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsang ba yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na rdo rje gsang ba chen po ste /
translated: Since it is the great secret vajra, it is the great secret vajra;

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: it is the mandala of Vajrasattva.

original: de yang gang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas rnam par snang mdzad bskul ba'i rjes thogs nyid la sprul par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas rnam par snang mdzad bskul ba'i rjes thogs nyid la sprul par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is that which the Lord Vajrasattva emanated immediately after he urged Vairocana.

original: de nyid dam tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig go //
translated: That itself is the pledge.

original: de'i 'byung ba ni dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa'i ye shes gang dang dkyil 'khor sten par byed pa'i ye shes gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba ni dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa'i ye shes gang dang dkyil 'khor sten par byed pa'i ye shes gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The emergence of that is the knowledge by which the mandala is consecrated, and the knowledge by which the mandala is entered; it is called that.

original: ye shes de nyid kyi phyag rgya gang yin pa'am /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid kyi phyag rgya gang yin pa'am / ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The mudra of that very intuition, or the samadhi, is so called.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
translated: The one who has entered into meditative equipoise on that is the one who has actualized it.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he has one-pointedly generated the mandala of Vajrasattva.🔽The reality of the great commitment, etc.

original: dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la dam tshig kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dam tshig chen po ste /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la dam tshig kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dam tshig chen po ste /
translated: The great commitment is so called because it is a commitment and it is great.

original: mi bskyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings te thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings te thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
