analyzed: der de lta bu'i 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa'i slob dpon gyis rang nyid 'jug par bya'o // de nas yang dag par mchod la zhes bya ba ni dngos grub thams cad rab tu bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The master who desires to attain such a fruit there should enter into it.🔽 Then, having made offerings means having made offerings to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan @83a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan @83a * //
translated: the accomplisher of all powers,

original: 'das gsang pa'i mchod pa bzhis yang dag par mchod cing /
analyzed: 'das gsang pa'i mchod pa bzhis yang dag par mchod cing /
translated: with the four secret offerings,

original: glu dang rol mos kyang mchod de /
analyzed: glu dang rol mos kyang mchod de /
translated: and with songs and music.

original: bdag nyid rdo rje sems dbar byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje sems dbar byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Having blessed oneself as Vajrasattva,

original: chu'i dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: chu'i dbang bskur ba /
translated: one should confer the water empowerment.

original: bcom ldan 'das las rdo rje thal mo bskor bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las rdo rje thal mo bskor bas /
translated: Having made the vajra-folded-hands gesture to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas la blang bar bya'o ;🔽/ rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de lta bu'i dbang bskur ba blangs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas la blang bar bya'o ; / rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de lta bu'i dbang bskur ba blangs nas /
translated: one should receive it from the Blessed One.

original: yang phyag rgya dang / cod pan dang / dar dpyangs dang / rdo rje dang / dril bu dang bcas pa'i dang po'i rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba blangs la /
analyzed: yang phyag rgya dang / cod pan dang / dar dpyangs dang / rdo rje dang / dril bu dang bcas pa'i dang po'i rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba blangs la /
translated: Having received the empowerment in that way, one should receive the first vajra empowerment together with the seal, the crown, the streamer, the vajra, and the bell.

original: yi ge h'um nyid zlos shing ming gi dbang bskur bas slob dpon bdag nyid dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um nyid zlos shing ming gi dbang bskur bas slob dpon bdag nyid dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting the syllable hūṃ, one should confer the name empowerment upon oneself.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub pa po rang nyid la dbang bskur ba stsol bar mdzad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub pa po rang nyid la dbang bskur ba stsol bar mdzad pa de'i tshe /
translated: “Or else,” etc. When the Blessed One Vajrasattva grants the conferral of empowerment to the practitioner himself,

original: skad cig de nyid la sgrub pa pos /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la sgrub pa pos /
translated: At that very moment, the adept

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub mchog rnams ma bsams bzhin du 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub mchog rnams ma bsams bzhin du 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will obtain the supreme feats of Sri Vajrasattva and so forth, without thinking about it.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' bdag nyid mthong ba ma stsal ba de'i tshe sgrub pa po'i ji skad bshad pa'i dbang bskur ba rang nyid kyis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' bdag nyid mthong ba ma stsal ba de'i tshe sgrub pa po'i ji skad bshad pa'i dbang bskur ba rang nyid kyis blang bar bya ste /
translated: When the Blessed Lord Sri Vajrasattva does not grant himself to be seen, then the adept should take the previously explained consecration himself.

original: de'i tshe lo phyed kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub ma chog 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe lo phyed kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub ma chog 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the adept who is endowed with uninterrupted practice for half a month will obtain the desired feat.

original: de nas rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de nas gzengs bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de nas gzengs bstod pa'o //
translated: Then, the vajra name consecration is also like that.🔽Then, all, etc.

original: de nas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang 'og nas bshad pa'i ming gi dbang bskur ba des dbang bskur ba de ni /
analyzed: de nas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang 'og nas bshad pa'i ming gi dbang bskur ba des dbang bskur ba de ni /
translated: The one who is consecrated with the name consecration that will be explained below is

original: 'dir rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba gnyis pa ste /
translated: Here, the second empowerment, the vajra-name empowerment,

original: rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba de 'og nas bshad pa'i tshul gyis blangs bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba de 'og nas bshad pa'i tshul gyis blangs bar bya'o //
translated: that vajra-name empowerment is to be taken in the manner explained below.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de nas byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Then, having performed the consecration, etc.,

original: de ltar lung bstan pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga byas la /
analyzed: de ltar lung bstan pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga byas la /
translated: having performed the ritual of entering, etc., up to the end of the prophecy,

original: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa bya ste /
translated: one should perform the self-consecration.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i cho gas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bsgrub pa byas la /
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i cho gas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bsgrub pa byas la /
translated: Having accomplished the seal of Vajrasattva, etc., with the characteristics explained below, by the ritual as desired,

original: dkyil 'khor chen po las byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po las byung bar bya'o //
translated: one should emerge from the great maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po gsang ba sgrub pa lan @83b cig bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang dkyil 'khor chen po 'di bshad ma thag pa'i gsang ba sgrub pa'i de nyid slob dpon gyis lan cig ste thang cig bya'i yang nas yang du ngal bso zhing bya ba yang
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po gsang ba sgrub pa lan @83b cig bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang dkyil 'khor chen po 'di bshad ma thag pa'i gsang ba sgrub pa'i de nyid slob dpon gyis lan cig ste thang cig bya'i yang nas yang du ngal bso zhing bya ba yang
translated: The phrase one should perform the secret practice of the great mandala refers to the fact that the master should perform the practice of the secret thatness of the great mandala that was just explained once, that is, for a single session, and not repeatedly, taking breaks in between.🔽🔽

original: ma yin la /🔽nyin zhag bzhi lnga'am /
analyzed: ma yin la / nyin zhag bzhi lnga'am /
translated: One should perform the secret practice of the great maṇḍala means that the master should perform the secret practice of the great maṇḍala, which was just explained, once, that is, for a single session, and not again and again, taking a break.🔽It is not performed for four or five days,

original: zla ba tsam gyis bya ba yang ma yin gyi /🔽gzhan du stan gcig la 'dug pa /🔽nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: zla ba tsam gyis bya ba yang ma yin gyi / gzhan du stan gcig la 'dug pa / nyid kyi tshe /
translated: or for a month.🔽Otherwise, one should perform the practice while sitting on a single seat

original: mtshan ma byung ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma byung ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: until the signs arise.

original: de nas slob ma gzhug par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas slob ma gzhug par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, one should induct the disciples.

original: gal te slob ma la gzhug par 'dod na snga ma bzhin du sdom pa bzung ba'i bar gyi cho ga byas la /
analyzed: gal te slob ma la gzhug par 'dod na snga ma bzhin du sdom pa bzung ba'i bar gyi cho ga byas la /
translated: If one wishes to induct the disciples, having performed the rite up to the taking of the vows as before,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya lnga po bsdus pa bcings la snga ma bzhin du slob dpon zhugs nas de bzhin du rdo rje rnam par sgeg pa'i phyag rgyas phyag byas te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya lnga po bsdus pa bcings la snga ma bzhin du slob dpon zhugs nas de bzhin du rdo rje rnam par sgeg pa'i phyag rgyas phyag byas te /
translated: Having bound the five-crested vajra-fist of intense joy, the master should enter as before, and having saluted with the vajra-play gesture,

original: h'um gi ngo bo nyid kyi snying pos snying po de nyid ci 'dod pa zlos pa'i slob dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um gi ngo bo nyid kyi snying pos snying po de nyid ci 'dod pa zlos pa'i slob dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the master who recites the essence mantra of the essence of HŪṀ as much as desired should accomplish the Blessed Vajrasattva.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das slob dpon gyi bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das slob dpon gyi bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the Blessed One be accomplished by the master?

original: phyag rgya chen pos zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen pos zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He declares, “with the great seal.”

original: phyag rgya chen po bcings pa la snying po 'don cing bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po bcings pa la snying po 'don cing bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish him by reciting the essence mantra while binding the great seal.

original: dam tshig dang chos dang las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig dang chos dang las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Not with the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, or the action seal.

original: mtshan ma de nyid 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni gang rdo rje thal mo bskor bas 'jug pa la bstan pa ni 'dir yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni gang rdo rje thal mo bskor bas 'jug pa la bstan pa ni 'dir yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “That very sign arises” means that which is taught by the entry through the vajra-palms gesture also arises here.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dngos grub rnams la bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma'i dngos po skyed par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dngos grub rnams la bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma'i dngos po skyed par mdzad pa ste /
translated: “All powers are accomplished” means that the powers of the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva and so forth are generated by the Bhagavān as the entity of the sign.

original: de bas na rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon du 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: de bas na rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon du 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: Therefore, one becomes the maṇḍala master of all the families.

original: / bzhugs pa 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ni lnga po bsdus pa'i 'jug pas so //
analyzed: / bzhugs pa 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ni lnga po bsdus pa'i 'jug pas so //
translated: “By this very entry” means by the entry that includes the five.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Likewise” means

original: ji ltar dang po'i 'jug pas dbang bskur ba thams cad thob pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar dang po'i 'jug pas dbang bskur ba thams cad thob pa'am /
translated: just as by the first entry one obtains all the initiations or

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi bar du thob pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi bar du thob pa ste /
translated: up to the state of Vajradhara,

original: de ltar na 'dis kyang dbang bskur ba thams cad thob pa'i dngos grub rnams thob par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis kyang dbang bskur ba thams cad thob pa'i dngos grub rnams thob par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, it shows that one attains the powers of all the consecrations.

original: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje blang ba la sogs pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje blang ba la sogs pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, having taken up the vajra and so forth as before,

original: ji ltar dang po'i 'jug pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar dang po'i 'jug pa na //
translated: as the first entry,🔽having previously taken up the consecration of water, the seal, the crown, the ribbon, the vajra, the lord, the name,

original: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas chu'i dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya dang / cod pan dang / dar dbyangs dang / rdo rje dang bdag po dang ming dang @84a * //🔽yung bstan pa rnams blangs la /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas chu'i dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya dang / cod pan dang / dar dbyangs dang / rdo rje dang bdag po dang ming dang @84a * // yung bstan pa rnams blangs la /
translated: and the explanation,

original: slob ma gzhug pa'i phyir rjes su gnang ba ma nos la slob ma gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa'i phyir rjes su gnang ba ma nos la slob ma gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should admit the disciples for initiation, and one should admit the disciples.

original: rdo rje slob ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽rdo rje sems dpa' byas pa'i slob ma de rnams la /
analyzed: rdo rje slob ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rdo rje sems dpa' byas pa'i slob ma de rnams la /
translated: The vajra disciples and so forth.

original: 'di ltar rdo rje slob dpon gyis gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa thams cad slob dpon nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje slob dpon gyis gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa thams cad slob dpon nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: The vajra master should perform all the extensive rites of entry and so forth for those disciples who have been made into Vajrasattva.

original: phyag rgya bcing ba yang bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis lha gang zhig bzung ba de la lha'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya thams cad bcing ba bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bcing ba yang bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis lha gang zhig bzung ba de la lha'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya thams cad bcing ba bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should learn to bind all the seals, the great seal and so forth, of the deities Vajrasattva and so forth, in the form of the deity that one has taken up.

original: sems can gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa lha thams cad kyi rigs la mos pa de rnams la yang dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa lha thams cad kyi rigs la mos pa de rnams la yang dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa thams cad bya'o //
translated: For those sentient beings who are devoted to the family of all the deities, the Tathagatas and so forth, one should perform all the extensive rites of entry into the mandala of the Tathagatas and so forth in this very mandala.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for the phrase “in the same way,”

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du khyad par gyi cho ga rgyas par 'byung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du khyad par gyi cho ga rgyas par 'byung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang bya ba ste /
translated: the extensive special rites that occur in the mandalas of the Tathagatas and so forth should be performed here in the same way.

original: gzhan dag gis ni de rnams kyi yid la ci 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni de rnams kyi yid la ci 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The attainments that they desire will not be accomplished by others.

original: khyad par gyi cho ga'i nus pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi cho ga'i nus pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the power of the special rite.

original: de nas lha gzhan dag la dad pa rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas lha gzhan dag la dad pa rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, those who have faith in other gods, etc.

original: lha chen po la sogs pa la dad pa yang dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du zhi ba'i mdung gis mtshan pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor cho ga rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: lha chen po la sogs pa la dad pa yang dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du zhi ba'i mdung gis mtshan pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor cho ga rgyas par bya'o //
translated: Those who have faith in Maheśvara, etc., should also enter this very mandala, and the extensive rite of the mandala marked with the peaceful spear, etc., should be performed.

original: de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They will also be accomplished, it is said.

original: ji ltar zhi ba'i mdung gis mtshan pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i mdung gis mtshan pa las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar zhi ba'i mdung gis mtshan pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i mdung gis mtshan pa las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the powers taught in the entry to the mandala marked with the peaceful spear are accomplished,

original: 'dir yang de las gsungs pa'i 'jug pa'i cho ga'i stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang de las gsungs pa'i 'jug pa'i cho ga'i stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, here also, by the power of the entry rite taught there, they will be accomplished.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de ltar slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: Thus, having caused the entry of the disciples, etc.,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i cho ga gang dang gang gis zhugs pa de rnams ni ji ltar zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i cho ga gang dang gang gis zhugs pa de rnams ni ji ltar zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have entered by whatever ritual of Vajrasattva and so forth are those who have entered.

original: zas dang ro'i bcud dang gnas pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis yang dag par tshim par byas la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas dang ro'i bcud dang gnas pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis yang dag par tshim par byas la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having satisfied them all with food, drink, and the essence of taste, and with all the means of abiding, and so forth,

original: zas thams cad ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa ji ltar grags pa @84b rnams so //
analyzed: zas thams cad ni bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa ji ltar grags pa @84b rnams so //
translated: all food is what is well known as food, drink, and so forth.

original: ro thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ro thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: All tastes are

original: shata la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: shata la sogs pa drug go //
translated: the six, beginning with sweet.

original: gnas pa ni gar gyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / 'chag pa dang / nyal ba dang / rgyud las bshad pa'i gnas pa rang gi lha'i ngo bo nyid du gsal ba'i yid kyis 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gar gyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / 'chag pa dang / nyal ba dang / rgyud las bshad pa'i gnas pa rang gi lha'i ngo bo nyid du gsal ba'i yid kyis 'dug pa ste /
translated: Abiding is sitting, standing, walking, sleeping, and the abiding explained in the treatise on dance, and the abiding explained in the tantras, sitting with a mind that is clear as the nature of one's deity.

original: de ltar zas dang ro dang gnas pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de ltar zas dang ro dang gnas pa thams cad de /
translated: Thus, all food, all tastes, and all means of abiding🔽are all of those.

original: de dag thams cad kyis slob ma thams cad ci 'dod par tshim par byas la /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis slob ma thams cad ci 'dod par tshim par byas la /
translated: Having satisfied all disciples with all of those, according to their desires,

original: rdo rje gar dang / mchod pa la sogs pa slob dpon gyis bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gar dang / mchod pa la sogs pa slob dpon gyis bya ste /
translated: The vajra dance, the offerings, and so forth are performed by the master.

original: slob dpon slob ma dang bcas pas /
analyzed: slob dpon slob ma dang bcas pas /
translated: The master together with the disciples

original: dkyil 'khor chen po mchod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po mchod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: should make offerings to the great maṇḍala.

original: bya ba 'di ni 'di nyid kyi 'og nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni 'di nyid kyi 'og nas shes par bya'o //
translated: This procedure should be understood from the following lines.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “just like that,” and so forth,

original: de ltar gar dang mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gar dang mchod pa byas nas /
translated: having performed the dance and offerings in that way,

original: ci nus pa'i tshul gyis zas dang skom la sogs pa'i longs spyod dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nus pa'i tshul gyis zas dang skom la sogs pa'i longs spyod dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: one should enjoy the pleasures of food, drink, and so forth, according to one’s ability.

original: de bzhin du bzlas brjod kyang byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlas brjod kyang byas la /
translated: Likewise, one should also recite the mantra.

original: ji skad ces pa'i gar dang glu dang dgod pa la sogs pas mchod pa ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad ces pa'i gar dang glu dang dgod pa la sogs pas mchod pa ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings with the dance, song, laughter, and so forth, just as they are.

original: de la 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir 'jug pa la ni /🔽bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa gzhan dag la bshad pa ltar /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir 'jug pa la ni / bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa gzhan dag la bshad pa ltar /
translated: As for “here, in this,” and so forth, in order to enter this great maṇḍala,

original: snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not investigate whether or not one is a suitable or unsuitable candidate, as is explained in other tantras, such as the Action Tantra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The entire realm of sentient beings and so forth are mentioned.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad ni gang gi phyir phyag rgya rnams kyis rang gi gzugs brnyan du rgyas btab pas /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad ni gang gi phyir phyag rgya rnams kyis rang gi gzugs brnyan du rgyas btab pas /
translated: The entire realm of sentient beings is sealed with the seals,

original: 'di dag ni bde ba chen po'i dam tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bde ba chen po'i dam tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these are the commitments of great bliss.

original: 'dir bde ba chen po ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bde ba chen po ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la bya ste /
translated: Here, great bliss is the beginningless and endless dharmadhatu.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje'o //
translated: That is the vajra.

original: de las byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul la sogs pa ni dam tshig go //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul la sogs pa ni dam tshig go //
translated: The mandala form and so forth that arise from that are the commitments.

original: ji ltar na yang 'di bde ba chen po'i dam tshig gi rdo rje yin zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang 'di bde ba chen po'i dam tshig gi rdo rje yin zhing /
translated: How is this the vajra of the commitment of great bliss?

original: phyag rgya thams cad kyis rgyas btab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad kyis rgyas btab pa yin zhe na /
translated: And how is it sealed with all the seals?

original: 'dod pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /
translated: It is said,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ni gnas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ni gnas te /
translated: the thought of all sentient beings is the abode.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i mngon sum du bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i mngon sum du bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The intention to manifest Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa na rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa na rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: is the completion of that, the manifestation of Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de nyid grub cing rdzogs pa ni rdo rje'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid grub cing rdzogs pa ni rdo rje'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That very accomplishment and completion is the vajra union.

original: rdo rje'i sbyor ba des ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sbyor ba des ni /
translated: By that vajra union,

original: rdo rje chos mnyam pa @85a * //
analyzed: rdo rje chos mnyam pa @85a * //
translated: the equality of Vajradharma

original: nyid kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyid kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the seal of all beings.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa ni rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa ni rdo rje chos so //
translated: Vajradharma is the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de rdo rje chos kyi mnyam pa nyid de rgyur gyur pa'i phyag rgyas sems can gyi khams thams cad rgyas btab pa 'di ni bde ba chen po'i rdo rje'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de rdo rje chos kyi mnyam pa nyid de rgyur gyur pa'i phyag rgyas sems can gyi khams thams cad rgyas btab pa 'di ni bde ba chen po'i rdo rje'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The equality of those is thusness, the equality of Vajradharma. That is the seal of the entire realm of beings, which is the cause of the vajra union of great bliss.

original: de bas na dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir gzhug pa la snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir gzhug pa la snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this great mandala, one should not investigate whether or not someone is a suitable candidate for initiation.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir zhugs pas ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid bcu khong du chud par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir zhugs pas ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid bcu khong du chud par 'gyur la /
translated: Because by entering this great maṇḍala, one will comprehend the ten suchnesses that are pure by nature.

original: de khong du chud pas ji ltar zhugs pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de khong du chud pas ji ltar zhugs pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: By comprehending those, the realm of sentient beings that have entered will accomplish the siddhis of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de bas na dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir 'jug pa la snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya'o //🔽de ltar na de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na dkyil 'khor chen po 'dir 'jug pa la snod dang snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya'o // de ltar na de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, in entering this great maṇḍala, one should not investigate whether or not they are a suitable vessel.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas slob dpong yi las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma zhugs pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas slob dpong yi las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma zhugs pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs pa yin no /
translated: Thus, the explanation from “Then, the bhagavān Vajrapāṇi” up to “the great maṇḍala” extensively explains the ritual actions of the master and the ritual of the disciples’ entrance and so forth.

original: // / gzhan yang de dag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / gzhan yang de dag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to clarify those,

original: cho ga thams cad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: cho ga thams cad bshad par bya ste /
translated: all the rituals should be explained.

original: de la dang po kho nar slob dpon dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid rdo rje byin gyis rlob pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig thob pa de las gsungs pa'i dam tshig yongs su skyong bas /
analyzed: de la dang po kho nar slob dpon dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid rdo rje byin gyis rlob pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig thob pa de las gsungs pa'i dam tshig yongs su skyong bas /
translated: Having obtained the samaya, he should protect the samayas as they are taught.

original: sems can yongs su dag pa gsang ba'i cho ga thams cad kyi bya ba shes pa dpa' ba /
analyzed: sems can yongs su dag pa gsang ba'i cho ga thams cad kyi bya ba shes pa dpa' ba /
translated: He should be heroic, knowing all the activities of the secret rite of purifying sentient beings.

original: brtan pa / spro ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtan pa / spro ba dang ldan pa /
translated: He should be steadfast, enthusiastic,

original: dul ba 'dul ba'i kun du spyod pa dang ldan pa la gnas pa dang pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dul ba 'dul ba'i kun du spyod pa dang ldan pa la gnas pa dang pa dang ldan pa /
translated: and endowed with the conduct of taming those to be tamed.

original: chos zab mo la lhag par mos pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo la lhag par mos pa /
translated: He should have faith in the profound Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su skyong ba'i blo dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su skyong ba'i blo dang ldan pa /
translated: He should have the mind to protect all sentient beings.

original: lus dang srog la ltos pa med pa dang / bcom ldan 'das yongs su mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang srog la ltos pa med pa dang / bcom ldan 'das yongs su mnyes par bya'o //
translated: He should be indifferent to body and life and should please the Bhagavān.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis rnams par dag pa la lhag par mos pas nang gi khrus byas la /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis rnams par dag pa la lhag par mos pas nang gi khrus byas la /
translated: Moreover, since he has faith in natural complete purity, he should perform the inner ablution.

original: chu'i khrus don du gnyer ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis kyang khrus kyi cho ga'am /
analyzed: chu'i khrus don du gnyer ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis kyang khrus kyi cho ga'am /
translated: Those who desire to take a water bath should do the bathing rite,

original: rang nyid ji ltar dga' bas chu'i khrus bya'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ji ltar dga' bas chu'i khrus bya'o //
translated: or else they should take a water bath in whatever way they like.

original: de nas lha'i khang pa dang nye bar phyin pa dang / de rkang pa gnyis bkrus la nye reg byas nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i khang pa dang nye bar phyin pa dang / de rkang pa gnyis bkrus la nye reg byas nas /
translated: Then, having approached the temple of the deity, having washed both feet, having performed the rite of purification,

original: h'um phat ces bya ba'i khro bo'i snying po lan brgya stong bzlas te /
analyzed: h'um phat ces bya ba'i khro bo'i snying po lan brgya stong bzlas te /
translated: having recited the essence mantra of the wrathful one, “hūṃ phaṭ,” one hundred thousand times,

original: g-yon pa'i @85b khro bo'i khu tshur g-yon phyogs su skor bas bgegs thams cad bsal la /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i @85b khro bo'i khu tshur g-yon phyogs su skor bas bgegs thams cad bsal la /
translated: having removed all obstructors by circling to the left with the wrathful fist of the left,

original: lha'i khang bar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i khang bar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: one should enter the temple of the deity.

original: de nas rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags yongs su bzlas pa'i spos chus rten dang lha'i khang pa bsang gtong byas la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags yongs su bzlas pa'i spos chus rten dang lha'i khang pa bsang gtong byas la /
translated: Then, having performed the rite of fumigation with the support and the temple of the deity with the water of the vase, which has been completely filled with the mantra of the vajra peak,

original: sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod la 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam zhes brjod la 'dug par bya'o //
translated: one should sit down, saying, “samaya stvaṃ.”

original: de nas yang lkog ma'i phyogs su yi ge hr'i: las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lce'i padma'i 'dab ma la h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa dkar po bskyed la /
analyzed: de nas yang lkog ma'i phyogs su yi ge hr'i: las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lce'i padma'i 'dab ma la h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa dkar po bskyed la /
translated: Then, in the throat, from the syllable HRĪḤ, one should generate an eight-petaled lotus, and on the petal of the tongue, a white five-pronged vajra from the syllable HŪṂ.🔽One should consecrate it with this [mantra]:

original: badzra dzi hva zhes bya ba 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: badzra dzi hva zhes bya ba 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: VAJRA-JIHVA.

original: lag pa gnyis su yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsams la /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis su yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsams la /
translated: In both hands, one should visualize two moon-disks from the syllable A.

original: de'i steng du h'um gnyis la rdo rje rtse lnga pa gnyis bsam /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um gnyis la rdo rje rtse lnga pa gnyis bsam /
translated: On top of them, one should visualize two five-pronged vajras from the syllable HŪṂ.

original: lag pa'i rtse mo yang h'um nyid las rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i gzugs su rnam par bsams la /🔽h'um las rdo rje me ltar 'bar bar bdag nyid sprul te /
analyzed: lag pa'i rtse mo yang h'um nyid las rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i gzugs su rnam par bsams la / h'um las rdo rje me ltar 'bar bar bdag nyid sprul te /
translated: The tips of the hands are also imagined in the form of a single-pronged vajra from the syllable HŪṂ.🔽One should emanate oneself as Vajra-Jvalanāgni from the syllable HŪṂ.

original: aom gri hna badzra sa ma ya h'um bam zhes brjod la /
analyzed: aom gri hna badzra sa ma ya h'um bam zhes brjod la /
translated: Reciting OṂ GRIHNA VAJRA SAMA YA HŪṂ BAṂ,

original: khro bo ti rinti ri'i phyag rgya bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: khro bo ti rinti ri'i phyag rgya bcing bar bya ste /
translated: one should bind the mudrā of the wrathful Tīrntīra.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang bcings nas //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang bcings nas //
translated: Having bound the vajra-bond,

original: yid kyis khros nas dgag bya la //
analyzed: yid kyis khros nas dgag bya la //
translated: with a wrathful mind, one should block

original: rdo rje mthe bo dam po ste //
analyzed: rdo rje mthe bo dam po ste //
translated: the vajra with the thumbs.

original: khro bo ti rinti ri rab bshad //
analyzed: khro bo ti rinti ri rab bshad //
translated: The wrathful Tīrntīri is explained.

original: aom badzra dzv'a la aa na l'arka h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra dzv'a la aa na l'arka h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra jvālānalā arka hūṃ🔽abhiṣiñcāmi maṃ

original: aa bhi shinytsa mam zhes bya ba dang / ti ri nti ri'i phyag rgyas rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa bhi shinytsa mam zhes bya ba dang / ti ri nti ri'i phyag rgyas rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba blang bar bya'o //
translated: With the Tīrntīri mudra, one should take the empowerment of the vajra garland.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings la mthe bo gnyis snyoms pa'i khu tshur spyi bor bzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje ti rinti ri ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings la mthe bo gnyis snyoms pa'i khu tshur spyi bor bzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje ti rinti ri ste /
translated: Forming the vajra bond, with the two thumbs placed together in a fist, place it on the crown. This is the vajra Tīrntīri.

original: 'dis spyi bo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dis spyi bo nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from the crown,

original: phyogs bzhir rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba'i tshul byas la /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba'i tshul byas la /
translated: in the four directions, one should act in the manner of bestowing the empowerment of the vajra garland.

original: yang phyag rgya 'di nyid dpral ba'i phyogs su bzhag nas gnyis su byas te /
analyzed: yang phyag rgya 'di nyid dpral ba'i phyogs su bzhag nas gnyis su byas te /
translated: Again, with this very mudra, place it in the direction of the forehead, making two.

original: dar dpyangs bcings pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: dar dpyangs bcings pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du byas te /
translated: Forming the ribbon-binding as it is,

original: mnyam pa'i thal mos lha rnams mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i thal mos lha rnams mnyes par bya'o //
translated: one should please the deities with the palms joined.

original: badzra tu shya ho //
analyzed: badzra tu shya ho //
translated: Vajra tvaṃ hoḥ

original: yang aom badzra dzv'a la aa na l'arka h'um zhes brjod de /
analyzed: yang aom badzra dzv'a la aa na l'arka h'um zhes brjod de /
translated: Again, saying oṃ vajra jvālānalā arka hūṃ,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i skyil mo krung bcas la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i skyil mo krung bcas la /
translated: one should sit in the vajra-hero posture.

original: g-yon pa rdo rje khu chur snying ga'i phyogs su bzhag nas /
analyzed: g-yon pa rdo rje khu chur snying ga'i phyogs su bzhag nas /
translated: Placing the vajra and bell at the heart with the left hand,

original: g-yas rdo rje gsor zhing bgegs thams cad gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas rdo rje gsor zhing bgegs thams cad gzhom par bya'o //
translated: and brandishing the vajra with the right hand, one should destroy all obstructors.

original: de nas h'um badzra aa na la ha na da ha pa tsa ma tha bhanydza ra na h'um phat ces bya ba dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la bgegs thams cad bskrad pa dang / bsreg pa dang /
analyzed: de nas h'um badzra aa na la ha na da ha pa tsa ma tha bhanydza ra na h'um phat ces bya ba dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la bgegs thams cad bskrad pa dang / bsreg pa dang /
translated: Then, with the mantra “Hum vajra anala hana daha paca mathita bhanjana hum phat,” and binding the pledge seal of Vajra-fierce-blaze, one should drive away all obstructors, burn them,

original: 'tshed pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'tshed pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: cook them, bind them, and so forth.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /
translated: Binding the vajra-binding in the inner way,

original: sor mo rnams nang du 'bar ba lta bur byas la /
analyzed: sor mo rnams nang du 'bar ba lta bur byas la /
translated: one should make the fingers blaze inwardly,

original: mthe bo rdo rje bsgreng ba 'di ni /🔽khro bo @86a * //
analyzed: mthe bo rdo rje bsgreng ba 'di ni / khro bo @86a * //
translated: and erect the thumbs like a vajra.

original: ti rinti ri zhes bya ba rdo rje me ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: ti rinti ri zhes bya ba rdo rje me ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the pledge seal of Vajra-fierce-blaze called “Tiring the Enemy.”

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings la mthe bo gnyis brkyang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings la mthe bo gnyis brkyang ste /
translated: Binding the vajra-binding, one should extend the two thumbs

original: bsdams pas la gzhag ste /
analyzed: bsdams pas la gzhag ste /
translated: and place them on the forehead.

original: badzra nee tri bandha sarba bighn'a na zhes bya bas bgegs thams cad bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: badzra nee tri bandha sarba bighn'a na zhes bya bas bgegs thams cad bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind all obstructors with vajra netra bandha sarva vighanān.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa brkyang la sa la reg par byas pa dang / aom badzra dri dho me bha ba raksha sarbam sv'a h'a zhes bya bas sa 'og bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa brkyang la sa la reg par byas pa dang / aom badzra dri dho me bha ba raksha sarbam sv'a h'a zhes bya bas sa 'og bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind the underworld with oṃ vajra dṛdhāme bhava rakṣa sarva svāhā, having extended the vajra binding and touched the earth.

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi spyan gyis nam mkha' bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi spyan gyis nam mkha' bcing bar bya ste /
translated: One should bind the sky with the eye of Vajrabhairava.

original: aom hu lu hu lu h'um phat /
analyzed: aom hu lu hu lu h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ hulu hulu hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de la 'di'i phyag rgya ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du bskor nas /
analyzed: de la 'di'i phyag rgya ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du bskor nas /
translated: The mudra for this is: Having formed the two vajra fists, one should rotate them like a firebrand,

original: mgo bo'i steng du mdzub mo lcags kyu ltar bzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi spyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mgo bo'i steng du mdzub mo lcags kyu ltar bzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi spyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: and place the index fingers like hooks above the head. This is the mudra of the eye of Vajrabhairava.

original: yang rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi rdo rje 'jigs byed spyan gyi steng du bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi rdo rje 'jigs byed spyan gyi steng du bcing bar bya ste /
translated: One should bind above the eye of Vajrabhairava with the vajra of Vajrayakṣa.

original: aom badzra yaksha h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra yaksha h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra yakṣa hūṃ.

original: rdo rje thal mo las mthe bo gnyis brkyang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo las mthe bo gnyis brkyang ste /
translated: From the vajra palms, one should extend the two thumbs,🔽and place them on the eyes.

original: mdzub mo gnyis mche ba lta bur byas te /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis mche ba lta bur byas te /
translated: Making two fingers like fangs,

original: khar bzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: khar bzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: placing them in the mouth, this is the mudra of Vajrayaksha.

original: rdo rje gtsug tor phyag rgya dang ldan pas shar phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor phyag rgya dang ldan pas shar phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Endowed with the mudra of Vajroshnisa, one should bind the eastern direction.🔽Om drum bandham ham.

original: aom drum bandham ham zhes bya ba'am /🔽trum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aom drum bandham ham zhes bya ba'am / trum zhes bya'o //
translated: Or drum.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mthe chung lu gu rgyud du sprel la /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mthe chung lu gu rgyud du sprel la /
translated: From two vajra fists, the two little fingers are joined in a chain,

original: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo sbyar te /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo sbyar te /
translated: the tips of the two index fingers are joined,

original: bzlog nas spyi bor bzhag pa ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bzlog nas spyi bor bzhag pa ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: and, reversing, they are placed on the crown of the head. This is the mudra of Vajroshnisa.

original: yang rdo rje zhags pas de nyid bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang rdo rje zhags pas de nyid bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Again, with the vajra noose, one should bind that very [direction].

original: h'um badzra p'a sha hri /
analyzed: h'um badzra p'a sha hri /
translated: Hum vajra-pasha hri.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mkhrig mar mdud pa bya ba ni rdo rje zhags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mkhrig mar mdud pa bya ba ni rdo rje zhags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two vajra fists are tied at the wrists. This is the mudra of the vajra noose.

original: rdo rje ba dan gyis nub phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ba dan gyis nub phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: With the vajra banner, one should bind the western direction.

original: aom badzra p'a tam ke ni ra ta /
analyzed: aom badzra p'a tam ke ni ra ta /
translated: Om vajra-patam kani rata.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las mthe bong gnyis sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las mthe bong gnyis sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du byas te /
translated: From the vajra-binding, the two thumbs are crossed in the gesture of the sattva-paryaṅk.

original: mdzub mo gnyis mnyam por phye la /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis mnyam por phye la /
translated: The two index fingers are extended together,

original: mthe chung gnyis ba dan ltar bya ba 'di ni rdo rje ba dan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe chung gnyis ba dan ltar bya ba 'di ni rdo rje ba dan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: and the two little fingers are like a banner. This is the mudrā of the vajra banner.

original: rdo rje nag mos byang phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nag mos byang phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Vajrāṅkuśī should bind the north.

original: hri badzra k'a li ru ta ma ta /
analyzed: hri badzra k'a li ru ta ma ta /
translated: Hūṃ vajra-kāli-rutāmata.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya nyid khar brtan par bzhag pa ni rdo rje nag mo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya nyid khar brtan par bzhag pa ni rdo rje nag mo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Vajrāṅkuśī is the same as the mudrā of Vajrayakṣa, placed firmly in the mouth.

original: rdo rje rtse mos lho phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mos lho phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Vajreśvara should bind the south.

original: aom badzra shi kha ra ru ta ma ta /
analyzed: aom badzra shi kha ra ru ta ma ta /
translated: Oṃ vajra-śikha-rutāmata.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du byed pa ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du byed pa ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Vajreśvara is the two vajra fists in the manner of lifting a mountain.

original: rdo rje las kyis dkyil 'khor bcing ba byas la ra ba bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje las kyis dkyil 'khor bcing ba byas la ra ba bya ste /
translated: Vajrakarma should bind the maṇḍala and make the fence.

original: h'um badzra karma /
analyzed: h'um badzra karma /
translated: Hūṃ vajra-karma.

original: yang rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi nang du rab byas te /
analyzed: yang rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi nang du rab byas te /
translated: Again, having made the inner enclosure of Vajrahūṃkāra,

original: h'um rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings @86b la ;
analyzed: h'um rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings @86b la ;
translated: The two vajra fists are bound,

original: mkhrig ma gnyis bsnol te /
analyzed: mkhrig ma gnyis bsnol te /
translated: the two wrists crossed,

original: mthe chung gnyis lcags kyur sbrel la /
analyzed: mthe chung gnyis lcags kyur sbrel la /
translated: the two little fingers connected with hooks,🔽and the two index fingers extended as threatening forefingers.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba mdzub mo gnyis sdigs mdzub tu bsgreng ba 'di ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba mdzub mo gnyis sdigs mdzub tu bsgreng ba 'di ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudra of Vajrahūṃkāra, called “Victorious in the Three Worlds.”

original: 'di nyid las gung mo dang mdzub mo gnyis rdo rjer bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid las gung mo dang mdzub mo gnyis rdo rjer bya ba ni /
translated: From this very mudra, the middle finger and index finger are made into a vajra.

original: rdo rje las kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the action mudra of Vajra.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa dang badzra bandha bam zhes bya bas rdo rje'i dra ba bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa dang badzra bandha bam zhes bya bas rdo rje'i dra ba bya ba'o //
translated: With the vajra bond and the utterance of “vajra bandha vaṃ,” the vajra net is made.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i spos chus snod lha'i khang pa'i sgor bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir gzhag la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i spos chus snod lha'i khang pa'i sgor bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir gzhag la /
translated: Then, with the perfume water of the completely purified vajrāveśa, one should place the vessel outside the door of the divine abode for sprinkling.

original: rdo rje me'i sngags bzlas pa'i spos chus mchod pa'i yan lag thams cad bsang gtor bya ba dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba phyag rgya dang bcas pa yang bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje me'i sngags bzlas pa'i spos chus mchod pa'i yan lag thams cad bsang gtor bya ba dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba phyag rgya dang bcas pa yang bzlas par bya'o //
translated: With the perfume water of the mantra of Vajrānala, one should sprinkle all the branches of offering, and also recite the mantra of Vajrānala with the mudra.

original: de nas aom badzra pushpe h'um zhes bya ba dang / me tog gi phyag rgyas me tog byin gyis rlob /🔽aom badzra gandha zhes bya ba dang / dri'i phyag rgyas dri /
analyzed: de nas aom badzra pushpe h'um zhes bya ba dang / me tog gi phyag rgyas me tog byin gyis rlob / aom badzra gandha zhes bya ba dang / dri'i phyag rgyas dri /
translated: Then, with OṀ Vajra PuS.Pe HŪṀ and the flower gesture, consecrate the flowers.🔽With OṀ Vajra Gandhe and the scent gesture, [consecrate] the scent.

original: aom badzra dh'u pe h'um zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje bdug pa'i phyag rgyas bdug pa /
analyzed: aom badzra dh'u pe h'um zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje bdug pa'i phyag rgyas bdug pa /
translated: With OṀ Vajra Dhūpe HŪṀ and the vajra incense gesture, [consecrate] the incense.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpa nna tv'a ta zhes bya ba dang / ral gri'i phyag rgyas lha bshos te //
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpa nna tv'a ta zhes bya ba dang / ral gri'i phyag rgyas lha bshos te //
translated: With OṀ A Ka Ro Mu KHaṃ Sarva Dharma Naṃ Adya Nnut Pā Nanta Tva Ta and the sword gesture, [consecrate] the food.

original: rdo rje bsdams pas ral gri 'debs pa ltar byed pa ni ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pas ral gri 'debs pa ltar byed pa ni ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The vajra-bound sword-slicing gesture is the sword gesture.

original: aom badzra a'a lo ke h'um zhes bya ba dang / mar me'i phyag rgyas ni mar me la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a lo ke h'um zhes bya ba dang / mar me'i phyag rgyas ni mar me la'o //
translated: With OṀ Vajra Āloke HŪṀ and the lamp gesture, [consecrate] the lamp.

original: h'um zhes bya ba dang / til dang / nas dang / ku sha dang / me tog dkar po dang ; 'bras yos dang / tsandan dkar po'i dung chos la sogs pa'i snod gtsang ma'i nang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba dang / til dang / nas dang / ku sha dang / me tog dkar po dang ; 'bras yos dang / tsandan dkar po'i dung chos la sogs pa'i snod gtsang ma'i nang du bzhag ste /
translated: With HŪṀ and sesame, barley, kuśa, white flowers, parched rice, white sandalwood, and so forth, place them in a clean vessel.

original: rdo rje thal mo kha phye ba'i mchod yon gyi phyag rgyas lan gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bar du yongs su bzlas la /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo kha phye ba'i mchod yon gyi phyag rgyas lan gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bar du yongs su bzlas la /
translated: Opening the vajra palms, one should recite the water for welcoming three, seven, or twenty-one times with the mudra of water for welcoming.

original: de dag thams cad gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gzhag par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be placed.

original: mchod rten thams cad dgug pa dang / bdag la byin brlabs sogs bsgrubs pas //
analyzed: mchod rten thams cad dgug pa dang / bdag la byin brlabs sogs bsgrubs pas //
translated: Having summoned all the stupas, and having accomplished the consecration, etc.,

original: rtag tu rdo rje dril 'chang zhing //
analyzed: rtag tu rdo rje dril 'chang zhing //
translated: always holding the vajra and bell,

original: dngos grub mchog ni bsgrub par bya //🔽lugs ma'am yang na brkos pa'am //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog ni bsgrub par bya // lugs ma'am yang na brkos pa'am //
translated: one should accomplish the supreme attainment.🔽Whether cast, or carved,

original: byas pa'am ni bris pa yi //
analyzed: byas pa'am ni bris pa yi //
translated: or made, or painted,

original: dang po'i 'khor lo'i gzhag nas ni //
analyzed: dang po'i 'khor lo'i gzhag nas ni //
translated: having placed it in the first wheel,

original: de ni slar yang rab tu bsgrub //
analyzed: de ni slar yang rab tu bsgrub //
translated: one should accomplish it again.

original: yi ge h'um 'don cing dang po'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: yi ge h'um 'don cing dang po'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Reciting the letter hūṃ, one should form the mudra of the first vajra.

original: aa nu r'a ga y'a mi h'um zhes brjod de /
analyzed: aa nu r'a ga y'a mi h'um zhes brjod de /
translated: Saying “anurāgāya hūṃ,”

original: sa la gzhag nas rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po sprul la /
analyzed: sa la gzhag nas rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po sprul la /
translated: having placed it on the ground, one should emanate the great maṇḍala of Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid khar gzhag na dkyil 'khor der rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid khar gzhag na dkyil 'khor der rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one places it in one’s mouth, one will be consecrated in that maṇḍala.

original: de nas gal te 'byor na me tog la sogs pas dkyil 'khor mchod @87a * //
analyzed: de nas gal te 'byor na me tog la sogs pas dkyil 'khor mchod @87a * //
translated: Then, if one has the means, one should worship the mandala with flowers, and so forth.

original: la ; aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsitta pra na me na badzra bandha nam ka ro mi zhes bya ba dang / phyogs thams cad du dkyil 'khor lnga bas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: la ; aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsitta pra na me na badzra bandha nam ka ro mi zhes bya ba dang / phyogs thams cad du dkyil 'khor lnga bas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa la phyag bya'o //
translated: With the words, “Oṃ. I pay homage to the vajra pledge of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas,” and with the five-prostration mandala, one should prostrate to the Bhagavān Vajrasattva and his retinue in all directions.

original: yang shar phyogs nas nub tu bltas te /
analyzed: yang shar phyogs nas nub tu bltas te /
translated: Again, facing east and looking west,

original: sngags 'di dang rdo rje thal mo brkyang nas lus thams cad kyis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di dang rdo rje thal mo brkyang nas lus thams cad kyis phyag bya'o //
translated: one should prostrate with the mantra and the extended vajra-folded-hands gesture, with one’s whole body.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza au pastha n'a ya /🔽a'atma nam niry'a ta y'a mi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza au pastha n'a ya / a'atma nam niry'a ta y'a mi /
translated: Oṃ. I offer to the worship of all tathāgatas🔽the self-originated.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra satva aa dhi tishtha sva mam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra satva aa dhi tishtha sva mam /
translated: All tathāgatas, establish me in the vajra being.

original: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las /
translated: Then, remaining in that way,

original: rdo rje thal mo snying ga'i phyogs su gzhag la /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo snying ga'i phyogs su gzhag la /
translated: one should place the vajra-folded-hands at the heart center

original: lho phyogs nas byang du kha bltas te /
analyzed: lho phyogs nas byang du kha bltas te /
translated: and, facing north from the south,

original: sngags 'di dang dbral ba sa la reg pas phyag bya'o //🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza aa bhi she k'a ya a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi /
analyzed: sngags 'di dang dbral ba sa la reg pas phyag bya'o // aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza aa bhi she k'a ya a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi /
translated: With this mantra, one should make prostrations by touching the ground with one's forehead.🔽Oṃ, all tathāgatas, I am offering the consecration to you.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra ratna aa bhi shinytsa mam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra ratna aa bhi shinytsa mam /
translated: Consecrate me with the vajra jewel.

original: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las /
translated: Then, remaining in that way,

original: rdo rje khu tshur spyi bor gzhag la /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur spyi bor gzhag la /
translated: place the vajra fist on the crown of one's head,

original: nub phyogs su kha shar du bltas te /
analyzed: nub phyogs su kha shar du bltas te /
translated: face west, looking east,

original: sngags 'di dang kha sa la reg pas phyag bya'o //🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza pra barta n'a ya /
analyzed: sngags 'di dang kha sa la reg pas phyag bya'o // aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza pra barta n'a ya /
translated: and make prostrations by touching the ground with one's forehead, with this mantra.🔽Oṃ, all tathāgatas, I am offering the declaration of practice to you.

original: a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dharma pra barta ya mam /
analyzed: a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dharma pra barta ya mam /
translated: I am offering the vajra Dharma to all tathāgatas.

original: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las /
translated: Then, remaining in that way,

original: rdo rje thal mo snying gar gzhag ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo snying gar gzhag ste /
translated: place the vajra palms at the heart,

original: byang phyogs su lhor kha bltas te /
analyzed: byang phyogs su lhor kha bltas te /
translated: face north, looking south,

original: sngags 'di dang spyi bos reg pas phyag bya'o //🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza karma ne /
analyzed: sngags 'di dang spyi bos reg pas phyag bya'o // aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza karma ne /
translated: and make prostrations by touching the forehead with the palms, with this mantra.🔽Oṃ, all tathāgatas, I am offering the activity to you.

original: a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi /
analyzed: a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi /
translated: I am offering the vajra activity to all tathāgatas.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra karma ku ru mam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra karma ku ru mam /
translated: sarva tathāgata vajra karma kuru maṃ.

original: de nas shar phyogs su pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs te 'dug la /
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs su pus mo gnyis sa la btsugs te 'dug la /
translated: Then, in the east, one should kneel on both knees on the ground,

original: rdo rje thal mo snying gar sbyar te /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo snying gar sbyar te /
translated: and with vajra-folded palms at the heart,

original: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bya'o //
translated: one should confess all one’s misdeeds.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su zhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su zhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang /
translated: “All buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, and all those who have entered the tathāgata, vajra, jewel, lotus, and action families, essence mantras, mudras,

original: gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha thams cad dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha thams cad dgongs su gsol /
translated: and all deities of secret mantra and knowledge mantra, please heed me.

original: bdag rdo rje ming 'di zhes bya ba phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyan sngar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su zhugs pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: bdag rdo rje ming 'di zhes bya ba phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyan sngar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su zhugs pa thams cad dang /
translated: I, Vajra named so-and-so, in the presence of all buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, and all those who have entered the tathāgata, vajra, jewel, lotus, and action families,

original: snying po dang phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi lha thams cad kyi spyan sngar sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
analyzed: snying po dang phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi lha thams cad kyi spyan sngar sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
translated: In the presence of all the deities of the essence, the seal, the mantra, and the knowledge-mantra, I confess each and every misdeed.

original: @87b phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: @87b phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: In the world systems of the ten directions,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang /
translated: I rejoice in all the merit of all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future, of all the Bodhisattvas, of all the Solitary Sages, of all the Noble Disciples, of all those who are on the right path and of those who are not,

original: sems can gyi tshogs thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la yang rgya cher rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la yang rgya cher rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
translated: and of all the hosts of sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi mdzad pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo dam pa bskor bar mdzad par bskul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi mdzad pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo dam pa bskor bar mdzad par bskul bar bgyi'o //
translated: I request all the Blessed Buddhas of the ten directions who have not entered final nirvāṇa to remain for as many aeons as there are atomic particles in all the fields,🔽and I request those who are entering final nirvāṇa to remain for a kalpa.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa de dag thams cad la yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa de dag thams cad la yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I request all the Blessed Buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions who are about to pass into parinirvāṇa not to pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: de nas me tog gi phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas me tog gi phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then, form the flower mudrā and recite this:

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: Whatever flower varieties there are in this world system,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
translated: and whatever flower varieties there are in all the world systems of the ten directions,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi me tog gi bye brag yid las byung ba'am /🔽chu las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi me tog gi bye brag yid las byung ba'am / chu las skyes pa'am /
translated: whether divine or human, whether born from the mind,🔽whether born from water,

original: thang las skyes pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thang las skyes pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: or whether born from the earth,

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir /
translated: I offer them all to all the Tathāgatas without exception for the sake of making offerings.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and to all the special deities of essence mantras, seal mantras, secret mantras, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpe p'u dza megha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /🔽bdug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpe p'u dza megha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um / bdug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata puṣpe pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /🔽gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /
translated: Form the incense mudrā and say this:🔽Whatever kinds of incense there are,🔽whether of gods or humans,🔽in this world system of the four continents,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi bdug pa'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am /🔽yang dag par sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi bdug pa'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am / yang dag par sbyar ba'am /
translated: or in any of the world systems in the ten directions,🔽whether naturally occurring or🔽produced through compounding,

original: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: or whatever has arisen from transformation,🔽all of them I offer to the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang /
translated: In order to perform the activity of making offerings to all the tathāgatas without exception, I offer to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas residing in the ten directions, together with the five families,

original: rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la @88a * //🔽dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la @88a * // dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and to all the special deities of essence mantras,🔽mudras, secret mantras, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pe p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pe p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata dhupe pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ

original: mar me'i phyag rgya bcings te 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mar me'i phyag rgya bcings te 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having formed the lamp mudra, one should say this:

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: Whatever is in this world system,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na /

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhabs drung du bdag nyid kyis lhag par mos par byas la ;
translated: In all the buddha realms in the ten directions, I imagine myself in the presence of all the tathāgatas.

original: lus kyis bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyis bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to serve them with my body,

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya ni ry'a ta na p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ, all tathāgatas, I pay homage and praise with the wisdom of the great wisdom of the perfection of ethics, the cloud of offerings of all phenomena.

original: de nas thams cad du kha dang lce brgya stong phrag snyed kyi sgo nas mnyam med mi g-yo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pas mchod pas lhag par mos par byas la /
analyzed: de nas thams cad du kha dang lce brgya stong phrag snyed kyi sgo nas mnyam med mi g-yo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pas mchod pas lhag par mos par byas la /

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'a ga ni ry'a ta na p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / bsam pa gcig pa'i sbyor bas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la lhag par mos par byas la /
translated: Then, with the application of a single intention, imagine that you make offerings to all bodhisattvas with the superior intention of the sameness of all phenomena.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsitta ni ry'a ta na p'u dza mi gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um//
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta tsitta ni ry'a ta na p'u dza mi gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um//

translated: Then, imagine that you make offerings with the superior intention of the nature of all phenomena being devoid of entity, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta gu hya p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /

analyzed: de ltar mchod pa rnam pa nyi shus de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod la bdag nyid dbul bar bya ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid dbul gyis /

analyzed: dus thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad du bdag so sor bzhes su gsol /

translated: May we be endowed with all the excellences of this world and the next.🔽May we be endowed with the happiness and mental joy of the supreme human state, buddhahood, in this very life.

analyzed: 'dis rang gi snying gar gzhug par bya ste /
